description:
I decided to order delivery from here and I have no regrets. The single burger with organic egg and bacon is amazing. If I had known it would be THAT good I would've ordered another one. Also the menu was so simple and straightforward. The only thing I forgot to get was a drink. :(

Anyways, I also got the caliber fries which was also really delicious. I shared them with my mother and she rarely likes eating fries but she was impressed. 

Overall, If you're nearby or just want something good, try this place out.
author: Chris L.

description:
Patties were dry. Would recommend getting the single instead of the double.

I ordered the double cheeseburger, calibur fries (cheese and grilled onions on top), and house ketchup. When my food came it reminded me of what I get at in-n-out. A new take on a classic with better ingredients perhaps. I bit into the burger and was disappointed. The beef wasn't moist at all, and there was barely any special sauce on the burger. I also  would've liked less onions on my fries. I really like the fries by themselves because they didn't have much salt, and the potato skins remained intact. The house ketchup was a blend that had a slight salsa texture to it, and tasted less salty. I've been noticing this new chunky looking ketchup around San Francisco, and I don't understand the appeal. 

I'd choose most fast food burger places over Calibur.
author: Keegan S.

description:
Story of my No-Burger Buddy and his Calibur experience in San Francisco's West Portal (*). I went with a friend who said he "didn't like burgers that much", and was, in his words, a "I like my meats cured" kind of guy. We order (I recommend the burgers medium well) and then have our burgers nicely delivered to the table. Thank you, Calibur team member, for bringing it over, sorry, I did have my nose in my phone as it was a website chat that came to my Slack, and I was checking to see that someone was responding (yep, I see that "Paz is typing..."). Back to burgers.

We start talking about "activation" techniques (he's a marketing guy), and I'm maybe 1.5 bites into my Calibur burger. I look at my buddy's basket and it's wiped clean, burger's gone, and he's surreptitiously licking his fingers. It's been like, 2 minutes since the burgers arrived.

Me: (raising eyebrow archly) You're done...? Already?
No-Burger Buddy: (sheepishly) yeah...
Me: I guess you were hungry.
NBB: Well, you were talking more than me. So I was eating.

I see what's happening, he's trying to say it's my fault he ate the burger so quickly. Like he couldn't get a word in. More like, his mouth was full.

Me: We've been here, like 2 minutes. What are we going to do for the next 30 mins, since you're done?
NBB: (eyeing my fries) You going to eat the no-tallow fries?
Me: You bet your cured-meats-only a__ I am. You can have 1. Ok, 2.

He ate all my Calibur fries. Now I have to go there tomorrow to get the no-tallow fries, my burgery taste buds feel cheated of their birthright.

* Calibur is an organic burgers fast-food restaurant in West Portal, been there a few years, super awesome on ingredients and taste. Calibur's burgers are so yummy and, surprisingly for a burger, super light on the tummy. And then there's the price: $6.99 for an ORGANIC burger, this delicious, this well made? Seriously? It's a no brainer. The no-tallow fries $3.50 are amazing. If you get to eat them because you have to share. Don't share, get your own, and put them in your basket and set little finger-sized mousetraps around it.
author: Vik C.

description: Burgers and fries are really good! Burgers are juicy but it's pretty pricy for a burger joint.
author: Lauren D.

description: This an awesome kind of hidden organic burger joint. Don't be fooled about an organic burger. I enjoyed it better than an in and out burger. The Calibur fries are much better than animal style fries. The milk shake was delicious. It was such a treat to find an organic burger that's so yummy West of Twin Peaks.
author: Juan V.

description: This burger joint has been my favorite out of all. They never disappoint me. I typically order a cheeseburger with lettuce, and caramelized onions, an order of fries, and a chocolate milkshake. This may sound like any other burger place, but the one thing that makes me come back time after time is the "Calibur Sauce". I have no idea what's in this Sauce, but it is so flavorful and goes with any burger and fries combination. Service is great, they are quick and friendly. So, if you are craving a burger, go to Calibur.
author: Jello O.

description:
We got delivery on a Wednesday night around 8pm and they came on time, food still warm. Love that their menu is simple and straightforward - they just do burgers, and they do them really well. 

THE COST: About $50 total for 4 burgers, 2 fries - a filling dinner for four. 

THE FOOD: 
* Single w/ Cheese, Red Onions ($7.74) - 4 stars
Tender, delicious patty, fresh ingredients. Good burger! My boyfriend added bacon and I wish I'd done that.

* Garlic Fries ($4.50) - 3.5 stars
Tons of garlic. Generally their fries seem fresh cut, but could use more crisp! 

* Calibur Fries ($4.50) - 3 stars
This is a lot - and just not for me! These are probably better fresh, not as great for delivery. Once the fries get cold and the cheese/onion topping congealed, it's not the most appetizing thing.
author: Ziyan C.

description: 50's diner with all organic and local ingredients. Delicious burgers, fries, and shakes. They also have a veggie option. Seems like a lot of people order takeout and delivery here, but there are also inside and outside tables to eat in.
author: Lindsay L.

description:
So I'm one of those people who rarely order burgers, but this place makes pretty damn good burgers!!

Located along West Portal, where you can find food and adventure in one street. 

Pros:
- Super straightforward menu, you customized your burger from the type of bun you want, to how you want your party cooked and the condiments. They also serve fries and shakes.
- Service was good, the person working at the cashier was patient and helpful.
- Simple interior with some tables for sitting.
- Close to the West Portal Metro line so if you need to do afterwards, there you go.

Cons:
- Parking on busy days is no bueno.

Literally the only place that cooks their patties the way you want it cooked. I like mine with a little pink (med well) and it came out juicy and oozing with flavors. My brother and bf both prefer medium and surprisingly both their burgers came out medium! Definitely try this place out if you want a juicy burger :)
author: Jerianne G.

description:
LOVE their burgers. 

Their menu is simple, but the food is solid!
I get the cheese burger with lettuce wrap, and I never leave with the heavy greasy feeling. 
The fries are a must.

The owner is super nice and genuine... This is the perfect local business that everyone should patronize.
author: Mimi T.

description: We wanted something quick as we had our granddaughter with us. We ordered a salad with a burger on top. I added blue cheese & bacon. It was tasty and enough for a lunch portion. We also ordered chili & cheese fries. It was tasty I should have realized the chili would make the fries soggy; but still good. They carry  Alameda soda which had nice flavor. They charge $1 for refills; honor system.  I'd return! The person taking our order was very helpful and nice!
author: Terese C.

description: Burgers are delivered warm. Real thick meat patties inside, so a single would actually suffice. Not greasy, not soggy, just perfectly delicious. The loaded Calibur fries are delicious. Worth the money for what they charge. It's been too long since I've had a really good burger. It hit the spot. Calibur sauce is good, but the ketchup is off the chain. Yummy!
author: Gessa C.

description: 1/2 lb burger. Lettuce, tomato, grilled onion, Calibur sauce, cheddar cheese. Absolutely. Delicious. It would have had an easy 5 if things didn't feel a bit stingy. The Calibur Sauce (from what I noticed) was good except there wasn't nearly enough of it on the burger. They do give you house ketchup and let you know there's regular ketchup available if needed. (Kinda sweet but not bad,I'm a sucker for house made things) The cheese fries were meh, just a little cheese melted in top (I think more of a nacho type cheese is better than square cheese melted but just an opinion... the cheese was good quality so I'm not mad)The service was absolutely amazing! Liz took our order and was patient yet efficient when doing so. Offered to grill the jalapeños if I wanted. Then if I'm not mistaken the owner was the one doing the food running and it felt super genuine and homey. I don't doubt if I would have brought up my sauce or meat issue that he wouldn't have been happy to fix it... But again the food was good so I didn't want to bug. The refills for the (fun and delicious) sodas are $1. I would rather not feel the pressure and just have  you charge a $1 for the drink itself or keep the fountain behind the counter.. I do wish they would have asked how I wanted my burger cooked as im a medium rare typa' gal and they only served well done. The bun was what really took this meal and made it something tbh. Idk what the secret to it is but it's delish and held the whole thing together. All in all I will def be heading back to check it out again, maybe I'll get a bigger burger, extra sauce and regular or garlic fries.
author: Tommi P.

description:
I have had burgers here a couple of times and as burgers go, I think their burgers are made great. It tastes like an indulgence and has got all the right things going for it - meaty, juicy, & flavorful. 

I'd probably eat here more if I could burn enough calories daily - otherwise I'd be morbidly obese in a month - because they also make killer milkshakes. 

The only thing I am not a fan of are their fries. They highly tout their tallow fried fries, but i think they are below average. They are not crispy enough and don't taste much different than non tallow fried fries.
author: Angelito R.

description:
This place has a simple and straightforward menu for hamburgers. I liked the way the food was delivered to the table with the description of the burger written on the paper mat ( helpful if you forgot what you ordered between the counter and sitting down ) The bun is sweet and soft. The extras are good with a choice of cheeses. Their home tomato sauce was very nice.
Refills on your drinks are $1. I didn't mind the sodas as they were not too sweet or syrupy.
author: Sue L.

description: Good burger, double wasn't dry like other reviews mentioned and they also have salads. Chicken is not an option and was difficult to find info on what Calibur sauce or Calibur fries were. Fries could be crispier. The average rating comes from the desire for more courtesy in the service. Tried to pick up my order and mr man-bun attendee acted like he was doing me a favor to hand me my order. What happened to "how can I help you"? Or "I'll be right with you"? Or "thank you for coming"? For the price, I'd still pick in-n-*** or super d***r but if you're in the neighborhood, they allow you to customize your burger and this is a decent option for good grub.
author: kiwi l.

description:
Meh, the burgers here are as overpriced as they're over cooked. More than $15 for a double cheese burger and a side of fries at a no frills place? No juice whatsoever in the patties and they skimp on the lettuce and tomatoes. Never seen such thin veggies in burgers. If you have it the "calibur" way, get ready to slather on ketchup yourself because the patties are so damn dry. I could also barely detect any cheese on my burger.

The bun is a substantial brioche bun, which would be great for juicy patties to soak up juices, but alas, these burgers are cooked way past the point of being appetizing. I think they use good meat because I can taste the beefiness but the patties are too thick to cooked to medium well. I asked for medium rare but nope. If you're desperate for a burger, there's no other easy options in the area, unless you count bulls head, but it's more of a sit down. I guess when you're the only fish in the sleepy part of town, you can do well despite being subpar and overpriced. And the cashier was annoying and uppity. I've been here three times keep hoping that maybe the previous time was a fluke because the reviews are good but never again.
author: Alice W.

description:
I'm from sac came up to the city for the day and found this place on yelp. LOVE IT great customer service bomb food and excellent presentation
I will be back next time I come to sf !
author: Melissa D.

description:
What a great burger! I had this bookmarked for months, and stopped by randomly on a Tuesday night and I'm so glad I did.

The place is clean, brightly lit, with a simple menu: burgers, fries, shakes, craft soda, salads. They also use local, organic, grass fed beef, so this is a bit more expensive than a diner burger, but so worth it to me.

I had a single burger (1/4 lb) with pickles, lettuce, cheddar, mustard + mayo (although they recommend their house sauce), caramelized onions. The bun was toasted perfectly on both sides, so no soggy burger! I think the bun is pretty thick (also delicious - does not taste/have the texture of sliced white bread like in most casual burger joints), so next time I'll get the double patty to get the proportions of meat to bread to my liking. Anyway, I loved the burger.

The people working there were friendly and helpful. The restaurant wasn't too crowded and it looked like most people were regulars. I can see why. I can't wait to be back and try the fries, sodas, and milkshakes.
author: Nelya T.

description:
Ok I had to try this place out with grass fed beef cow .  Moo! Moo! This place is like hidden well in the West Portal district. I have never noticed it before. The M and K train  bus  lines pass by here.  I had tried another burger place just last Friday and thought about comparing it with this burger place as well since it's more of fast food gourmet burgers. Well I am glad I took a chance with this place because I can say more confidently that I will return here. 

The burger was pretty big that what you normally see in fast food burger restaurants. They use real burger meat , meaning not like microwave patties. It's pretty thick, so I don't mind paying more for this burger. They grill it to medium or medium well. The beef is organic grass fed, so Holsteins cow  should have had a happy life eating natural grass at the Cream Co.. The bun is shiny and pretty and texture is different and I like it. If you open up the bun to inspect the burger, they use smaller red tomatoes  which I think tastes better.  Ingredients are fresh looking. Oh I forgot to mention that the brown paper wrapper on the burger was wrapped nicely and it caught the juices of the burger nicely.  Not oily burger or garlic fries. 

They made my orders pretty quickly because I don't think I waited that long. It was nicely packed by the worker and delivered to my table.  I had ordered a single burger, double burger, garlic fries that came with fresh tomato sauce and Alameda Point soda fountain root beer. 

Not too busy on Sunday night at 5pm. There were take out drivers coming in to deliver burgers people too lazy to cook for the night or come in person. LOL  

I would like to return to try a milkshake or soft serve  cone on hot day and try another burger with their Calibur sauce because they forgot to pack into my take out bag because I had order my sauces on the side.
author: Priscilla L.

description: The Calibur fries are great, the special Calibur sauce they put on the fries is very tasty.  I had the garlic fries and they were really good too. The burgers are good but I think the patties were somewhat over cooked which made the hamburger a little dry. Overall, I rate this place 5 because everything is very fresh and as you can see from the photo, the presentation is really about as good as it gets for burgers and fries.
author: Kim B.

description: Healthier, tastier, slightly less juicy In-N-Out ("Calibur style" is basically their version of it). I got the gluten-free bun, which was divine. And everything was super tasty without being too greasy. The handcrafted Alameda Point sodas were very flavorful and enjoyable, and the milkshake was heavy on the ice, light on the cream. Felt good afterwards in a way I normally don't after eating at burger places. Maybe because it was all organic? Can't wait to go back!
author: Omar Y.

description:
Not bad, actually pretty good. 

In an area now overrun with the stroller mafia and overpriced meal choices, was confused by the window signs in this place showing $4.99 and $6.99 deals. Upon closer inspection, the "deals" were for a soda and fries or s milkshake and fries respectively. I don't know about you, but I usually go to a burger place mostly for a burger. But, I digress. 

Having been disappointed by these types of places before, I cautiously checked them out recently. Burger and fries will set you back around $13-14 total. So, be prepared, this isn't In and Out. 

Seating is a few tables inside and a couple outside, I can see if it's busy you'll eat standing or make a friend. 

Food finally arrived, first thing that struck me was the excellent bun and a clear delicious dill pickle staring at me from inside. Looked fresh. And though I ordered a "kids" meal to test the waters, it seemed enough. Good size of fries but not much meat. 

Tallow fries remind me of when BK and McD used to have decent fries, these were great, and even better with whatever that ketchup is that is on tap. And the kid burger was quite delicious despite the tiny patty, using fresh pickles makes a huge difference. I'll definitely splurge on a full burger someday when my appetite and Bitcoin balance justifies it. 

So, all-in-all its a better burger than the silly "deal" signage and ambiance generally lets on. Looking forward to another visit sometime, trying to cut down on burgers but will keep this place on that "when I do" list.
author: T J.

description: A surprisingly good burger in what normally was a sleepy location. This type of spot is exactly what West Portal needs more of. Great food good pricing and super convenient if you need to grab a quick bite before jumping on Muni. They also make their own ketchup which is not only tasty but has less sugar and salt then the leading brand. It almost offsets the enormous Burger you get. But you're not eating a hamburger for health reasons so there you go.
author: ben R.

description:
Calibur is a pretty decent burger place on West Portal, averaging ~$7 for a single cheeseburger without the add-ons (bacon, fried egg, or avocado). Despite the buns being too thick/dense and chewy, the burger itself was tasty. The beef patty was juicy, cooked to a medium/ medium-well. The fries were good too, crispy outside, soft on the inside. Order the fries "Calibur style", which is their version of a thousand island with mayo and relish blend with caramelized onions.

Service is quick and friendly, and the ambiance is very simple and bright. Limited outdoor seating is also available, which is nice option on a warm day.
author: Priscilla W.

description:
Definitely better than the last time I was here. A bit on the pricey side since they use local and organic products. I got the single burger with an organic egg, Calibur sauce, onions, tomatoes with a side of fries and soda.  Flavors were just right and bonus is they had hot sauce!

Coming back here and is a good family spot as well
author: Me V.

description:
It's was decent, but I Feel like for the price it just didn't shine enough to get four stars. 

The meat of the burger was decent. I wasn't blown away, but definitely satisfied. 

Amount of toppings was fine, but not NEARLY enough sauce.  I got calibur sauce and mayonnaise and I couldn't really tell  there was much of any. Next time ask for extra sauce. Mushrooms were good.  My husband added an egg and it was way over cooked for him, so if you like it runny - make sure to specify. 

Garlic fries are standard. They were on the soft side and VERY oily. The house made ketchup was quite nice. 

The artisan sodas were interesting. The black cherry wasn't too sweet. 

It's a pretty small place, but was really not crowded on Saturday night. There is a tv which had sports on.  

Food took about 10 minutes to come out.
author: Sarah C.

description:
Pricey for two cheeseburgers, 1 garlic fry, 1 chili cheese fry and 2 shakes = $43
Taste- excellent!!!  The homemade ketchup to die for!!  The staff were uber  friendly.
author: Karen T.

description: Great burger place!! The buns are toasted, fresh ingredients, and so tasty. French fries are hot and crispy. House ketchup was yummy and their milkshake is authentic. I like their simple menu too which makes ordering very easy. Definitely will come back for a tasty burger.
author: Lena H.

description: Stopped here on a whim. The food was pretty good and they got my order right (I liked all the options.) I did feel like it was a bit expensive though. $23 for a burger, shake, and cheese fries, although I did add egg and bacon to my burger.
author: Estela M.

description: Wow, what a great place. Once you find parking, this place is definitely a treat. Love the clean, fun decor and the friendly staff. The burgers are fantastic and so are the fries. We tried their homemade ketchup and Calibur sauce and wished we could take some home. We will definitely be back.
author: Jonathan S.

description:
While visually appealing the Veggie Burger is bean based and it tastes more like a burrito than a burger. It has a very "mushy" texture.

If they added another non-beef option I'd give this place another try but for you vegetarians craving that burger taste, look elsewhere.
author: JeremyJT ..

description:
Really nice burger! Got a triple. Greasy as a burger should be.
Fries with cheese were not so good. Fries was not crispy.
Great staff
author: Jens E.

description: First time that I've ate at this place. I'm very impressed. Very clean. Peaceful. Cool place to eat. Not that many menu selections but glad they have what I've want. The wait is not long. Food in good temperature and food taste delicious. Does not make you full or bloated but no longer felt hungry. I love that they have sodas that I have never tried before and shake was not sugary. Reasonable price and will go again.
author: C G.

description:
A one-liner if you don't want to read: I would 100% rather buy an In-n-Out burger. 

This might just be me, since I see a lot of good reviews, but I just wasn't impressed at all. 

The place is quaint and fairly clean, and the staff is nice enough. But I didn't think the burger (and other items) were all that great, given its price point.

We got the 1/2 lb double (currently $8.99)The burger had decent buns, but I think it says something when the patty is literally half the size of one of the buns. The beef patty was just soooo dry and basically well-done since it was so thin, and not seasoned enough. Everything else was standard. Nothing really stood out. They actually forgot onions on both of our burgers, but they were nice enough to provide some when we asked.

It's not on the menu, but we ordered garlic cheese fries. DON'T BOTHER. It was $4.49 (?!) for the cheddar fries (aka a small portion of also not really seasoned, borderline limp fries with one slice of sad melted cheese) + an additional $1.50 (?!?) for some kinda weird tasting garlic barely mixed in and dolloped on top. Tfw you're actually more impressed with McDonald's garlic fries than these???

And the soda. I sound like I'm nitpicking at this point but like c'mon. $2.25 for one of those iced coffee cups of your off-brand fountain soda and then $1 for refills? But if your burger turned out as dry as ours...you just might need it.
author: Katerina T.

description:
Triple burger calibur style!
The melting cheese, the delicious juices over flowing.
Amazing.

15$ for this wonderful creation. (Cheese was extra, added jalapeños)
The reason why I didn't give this 5 stars is because they cook their burger medium to medium well.
I like my burgers medium rare, pink throughout.
Aside from that. Great! P
author: Andrew S.

description: Maybe, I'm just being a jerk. I just ordered this on caviar. This bun is way too much, Not feeling it. Truly disappointed. So many good reviews. If you really think this is good you've never experienced Roam burger. Ended up giving it to my husky.
author: Sasha M.

description: Tried the veggie burger, sort of a mix of bean patty and garden burger. It was ok, seasoned well. Bun was tasty and toasted. Vegetarian fries were standard (other option is fried in beef fat). I didn't ask for it but came with chunky ketchup, a bit sweet salsa like. I'm glad there was a vegetarian option but as a vegetarian I probably wouldn't go out of my way to come here again. Lots of toppings to customize your burger...for additional cost.
author: Sam L.

description:
Solid spot for "Mmm I'm craving a something that will stick to my ribs and is moderately comfort-y but don't feel like cooking" kind of evening. 

Good burger with good meat flavor, nice soft brioche bun, lettuce wraps for the Paleo/Keto types if needed. Shakes are decent. Fries in tallow are  good though not as brilliant as I expected, but solid!

Excellent selection of toppings and add-ons available. 

Pretty quick, manages a call in order well, friendly staff. 

I like that I can browse in a favorite bookshop next door while I wait.

My top pic for a burger near where I live if you aren't making it yourself at home.
author: Susan F.

description:
When I first heard about Calibur (thanks, Cat C.!), I practically bookmarked them immediately.  Not only did their burgers look and sound great, but their location is so convenient - across the street from Empire Theater in West Portal, where parking is pretty painless.  So, in this case, I really don't have an excuse for not making it here sooner, unfortunately.  One of these days, I'm sure I'll get to one of these places as fast as I bookmark them.  Hopefully...

From the moment we stepped in, even though I hadn't been here before, Calibur felt mildly familiar.  From the pure white colored walls, to the red accents, to the (relatively) narrow menu, it had a loose resemblance to In N Out, albeit a little nicer and without the uniforms.  Still, despite the absence of pre-set combinations, there are plenty of ways you can customize your burger, starting with whether you want a single or double patty and ending with your choice of garnishes, sauces, and add-ons, which do have up-charges (https://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/calibur-san-francisco?select=6xbcS_5-u8dqPX3ItGLPcg).

-- GARLIC FRIES...$4.49
-- CALIBUR FRIES - French Fries topped with Grilled Onions and Calibur Sauce...$4.49
(https://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/calibur-san-francisco?select=GqNIQy6ns5lhqKbuQEPVBg)
Both varieties had me excited, but neither blew me away.  Of the two, the Garlic Fries were better; crispy and garlicky, though all that rosemary was overwhelming.  As for the Calibur Fries, they're kind of like In N Out's Animal Style Fries, but without the cheese. Not bad, and pretty interesting, but the grilled onions, while sweet, tasted a little bitter/burnt.

-- DOUBLE AMERICAN BURGER with Bacon (+$1.50) "Calibur Style" (Calibur Sauce, Lettuce, Tomatoes, and Grilled Onions, though I subbed them out for Raw Red Onions)...$9.49
(https://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/calibur-san-francisco?select=55tgsPzMDMYsXSd3CJN0ww)
Granted, I got the double, but this was still one hefty burger!  The patties (cooked med well) were juicy and well seasoned and the strips of bacon just made it meatier.  At the same time, the burger didn't feel overly greasy and I liked how soft the bun was.  Too bad you can't choose the type of cheese, though you can sub for $.50 more per patty.

Even though I've only had their burgers once (for now...), I'm definitely a fan of Calibur.  They may fall short of comparably priced spots like Super Duper, but they're definitely better than most of the other neighborhood burger joints I've been to, like Tower Burger or Jenny's on 9th Ave.  Tasty burgers, friendly staff, awesome location...I'm a fan and will definitely be back for more!
author: Mike L.

description: The burgers here were delicious! The menu is small, but with the offered ingredients you really can customize the burger into a variety of combinations. My friend and I both enjoyed our burgers, and we also shared garlic fries which were also pretty good. I definitely think the burgers win over the fries. You pay right after you order, and usually at places like this, it's pretty much self service. But to our surprise, the employees actually brought our food out to us, and we didn't have to get up to grab it ourselves. Our server was also very nice.
author: Z C.

description:
A great burger and delicious fries. I compare all burgers and fries to Roam, and while this burger isn't quite as good, it still rates. I love that the meat is organic, their house sauce is great, and the staff is always so kind and on top of it. 

There is always ample seating, including a couple tables outside for nice days. This is an easy place to take kids or a baby too, since there is always good music playing and no one seems to mind a little extra noise.
author: Megan B.

description:
So, this is maybe my 5th time here. Always polite and thorough service, let's add considerate and client conscientious ... chomping on my cheese fries not paying attention and this kind gentleman walked by noticed I hadn't taken more than 2 bites out of my burger, little did he know the burger was perfect, and offered to redo my burger. I told him the hot cheesy fries had beckoned my attention and my stomach. My husband and I appreciated the attention and the gesture, so nice. 

He retrieved a take home container and a bag and bussed our table. We were even given free shake samples. 

Love this place.
author: elizabeth c.

description:
Tasty, juicy and "complete" burgers. The burgers hold themselves together really well and every bite was great. Sometimes I have a burger and find something is missing or that half the burger is just some bread and lettuce but not at Calibur.

We came hungry on a weekday at 2pm and the place was empty. I didn't hold back and had a double American Calibur style with added bacon and egg, so good, just the right amount of everything. I also got the garlic fries, the fries were cooked really well, the garlic was solid but didn't hook me enough that I wouldn't try something else next time.

Chocolate shake was yum and it was interesting to see a non "Coca-Cola" soda fountain (the coke was good too)!

Overall a simple burger joint that does a solid burger and fries!
author: Tristan L.

description: The food was not good at all,but what's worst is the rude staff this place has. Never will I spend one cent at this "ORGANIC" place again.
author: Edgar M.

description:
Three stars for the food minus one star for the grumpy server who yelled at my husband when he asked about the shakes we had ordered for our kids. My husband wasn't in the wrong to ask. The server had dropped off the burgers and never mentioned the shakes are coming. 10 minutes later when my husband walked up to ask, the server's body language and words both shocked all of us. Not only did he do that once, he stayed that way. He was frowning when he came to pick up the empty plates. My son took longer to eat and my husband took the place to the front which was not unusual since this was a self service restaurant. Instead of thanking him, once again the server was rude. 
In a restaurant full of Caucasians, we were the only Indians and it's hard to not think of the obvious when your Caucasian server has an edge that that he reserved only for you. 
We are never going back.
author: Ashima S.

description:
High quality food and very allergy safe.  No
Nuts, seafood, sesame 
Love the shake.  Tasty fries.  Great spot.
author: Pauline C.

description: Horrible service!!!! We got the garlic fries and it was literally floating in oil.... We asked for the fries to be changed to a regular one because after seeing the amount of oil i couldn't eat it. The manager walked out of kitchen and was trying to proof to me that it's fine that the amount of oil that they put in there is fine. He finally agreed to bring us a regular fries but after a minute or two the whole staff walked out of kitchen one by one and gave us "the look". Seriously, my family left there almost $100.00 and that's what we got! Never ever again i'm going back to that place!!!!
author: Svetlana D.

description: Do you guys have your own farm? The ingredients were really fresh. Ask for no salt on your fries, it was a bit salty for my liking. The meat pattie was a bit thin, next time I'll get the double stacked.
author: Annie Y.

description:
Calibur was awesome! I loved the fact that they grind their own organic grass fed beef daily and their ingredients are all organic. 
I had a group of 20+ and contacted the business if it was possible to accommodate us, the place looks smaller... Sean replied and was SUPER helpful! He explained the ordering process when I arrived and even took his tablet to our reserved tables and took all our orders. 

Great ingredients + friendly staff = a returning family!
author: Liz N.

description: The chili here is amazing! Seriously! You have to go try it! Great customer service too.
author: Brittany G.

description:
this update is long overdue.  we have eaten at calibur multiple times since my last review and it has been wonderful.  when they first changed their menu there was definitely a dip in taste, quality and experience but they seemed to right the ship and this is one hell of a great burger and for the price, you cannot beat it.  

we have tried a variety of different things from calibur including the salad, burgers, grilled cheese and veggie burgers.  the salad is plentiful, rich with fresh veggies, and whatever additions you ask for.  its hearty and large enough to be an entree or split.  the burgers are great...juicy, fresh, great quality meat, and the bun is delicious!  the grilled cheese will bring you back to your childhood...its griddled and yummy comfort.  the veggie burger was not the best i have had but certainly not bad at all...it was solid and flavorful,  the fries are great...i suggest having them cooked crispy.  

in all honesty i have not eaten in the actual place because i always order takeout but i can say that the food holds up great with delivery and is really a great burger.
author: Samantha B.

description: I thought this place would be really great and I think it probably is but the delivery was pretty screwed up. I ordered and didn't get my food for about an hour and a half. Sure, they (grubhub) gave me a coupon for next time, but the burger was pretty dry and the fries were soggy. I'd like to think that the food there is way better than what I had delivered. It makes me wonder though, if I ran a restaurant I might not want to send an order out the door that was sitting there under a heat lamp for over an hour. Or might want to reconsider my options for having food delivered. There are a lot, and Grubhub fell down hard on this one. They just didn't follow through well. Caveat Emptor!
author: Debbie B.

description: Great food, always great service. Only bad encounter was when the cashier asked me if I wanted lettuce and tomato on my BLT. Lol
author: Audra H.

description:
Not bad. Was looking for a nearby lunch spot at West Portal and came across Calibur. Friend and I came here on a Sunday around 1PM. There were a couple others at the restaurant as well. The cashier was nice and friendly.

We ordered two single burgers and fries. The fries came with housemade ketchup, which tasted good. My friend didn't like it and opted for regular Heinz ketchup instead. The fries were nice and crisp. The burger itself was alright. I was not blown away. Think it would have been better if it were juicier. 

This is a good place to stop if you are nearby, but not to make a trip out of going here. It's a fairly big restaurant, so you can bring a group if you wanted. Prices are fair. Not super cheap but paying for better quality.
author: Christina G.

description: Amazing burgers for the first time me and my boyfriend went to try this spot out we drove from San Jose to the city to find this spot, the manager/owner ? Not to sure was the most helpful person n very friendly! Best burgers ever you have to try!!
author: Jessica A.

description:
Really great local spot with legit burgers and fries. Came on a weekend night and it wasn't too crowded, so got a table and got to enjoy pretty quickly.

Burger was good. Would have loved it even thicker and juicier and maybe even a bit more salty, but overall with bacon and cheese was really enjoyable. Not sure how they are outside of burgers - one of our kids' grilled cheese was mistakenly served as a cheeseburger - so probably stay on the core of the menu.

A bit disappointed in the beverage options (shakes and sodas), so drank water.

Overall good, but not worth a long trip.
author: Bob K.

description: The burgers were excellent! I love the sauce on the caliber burger. The fries were nice and thick and the customer service was great. I really thought the owners was nice and accommodating  and we would go back next time we go to SF .
author: Susie M.

description: Awesome burger.. what More can I say..fresh ingredients..perfectly cooked.will definitely eat here again next time I'm in Frisco.
author: Louie R.

description: After a long day at work I tried to order delivery from Calibur as advertised on Yelp. When I tried to start the order a message "delivery unavailable appeared." So fine, I called to place an order to pick up. Someone hung up. Tried again. Got answering machine. Message on answering machine said do not leave an order on this machine. Tried again. Same result. Next try-busy signal. I give up. Apparently, Calibur isn't into taking orders. Guess they have all the business they need.
author: Barbara C.

description: Info for vegetarians: The veggie style Calibur fries (with sauce and grilled onions) were very tasty. The veggie burger, on the other hand, was a disappointment. It was a bean patty with an assertive cumin flavor, which overpowered the flavors of all the toppings, which individually seemed fresh and good, but I couldn't taste them at all.
author: Carol A.

description:
Ma and Pa burger spot, with all the delicious and healthy options and fixins with a vintage 50's feel with a touch of 'modernness'...This was our first time here;  we definitely frequent organic food restaurants and burger joints when we have cheat meals off of our meal prep planning.  We definitely support Ma & Pa businesses nowadays especially with all the corporate companies coming in and making it a little bit more difficult for them to survive.  We'll rate on a few items:

Atmosphere 5/5 - relaxed and calm, with some good R&B playing in the background.  It was actually a perfect atmosphere for my girlfriend and I.  Plus the place was VERY clean.  We walked up and we were greeted by the cashier who was very friendly and definitely took pride in the 'human experience' of taking your order, giving excellent customer service and also describing what you were buying and/or asking about.  Our orders are always complicated because we have certain food allergies and choices so we take note if the person serving us is kind and patient or rude and inconsiderate. They were definitely kind here.  

Prices 5/5 - not cheap nor expensive; everything is fair and priced right in my opinion.  Grass fed beef and organic ingredients are expensive, and owning a restaurant anywhere in the bay area is expensive.  No complaints here.  

Food 5/5 - Burgers- we got lettuce wrap burgers with everything.  Beef patties were delicious and good sized.  All the veggies on the burger were fresh and tasty.  I normally hate pickles in my burger, but these were perfect, and the tomatoes were Roma, so they have a different taste (better than regular tomato's) Nothing was too seasoned or over cooked/spiced.  The meat tastes like MEAT, the way it's supposed to.  Not too lean or fatty, just right. The oils trickling off weren't too fatty or gross, but just perfect. All delicious and fresh.  The house sauce is bomb too. FRIES - we got garlic fries caliber style- these were amazing.  The soda is quality craft soda, sorta like HANSEN brand.  Very good quality.  My lady and I shared a diet soda and it was definitely better than any Diet Coke/Pepsi.  
They have homemade ketchup and house sauce- try both.  I love ketchup but hate how there is so much sugar in Heinz and other organic brands.  This ketchup was the biz  everything was just really tasty and excellent quality.  

Overall- 15/15 perfect score from us.  this establishment is about quality and high standards from the chairs and tables, to the staffs attitude and all of that trickles into the food quality and presentation. The food was wrapped perfectly in the wrapper and every detail was carefully looked over.  After ordering we went back up to get another item to go.  We noticed a kind gentleman training a new employee behind the counter.  I could tell this man took a lot of pride in the business and really made a positive effort for success and training his employees. Having experience with many types of businesses, i asked him if he was the owner.  He said 'yes' and we chatted for quick minute.  He later brought our food to us and was VERY kind.   Thank you Sean for a great experience, we will return and recommend your business.  We wish your restaurant a lot of success and positivity.  The only feedback We will give is maybe hang some photos up on the walls, if you're into that-we were thinking classic muscle cars.  But if the plain white is the 'look' that's cool too.  We live in San Bruno, and will make the trip back!
author: Dom G.

description:
A lazy Saturday (January 2nd) led me to lunch delivery. I wanted burgers and the roommate didn't want to leave the house, so we placed an order through Caviar. We submitted the order at 2:05pm and it arrived at 2:43pm. (I live in Outer Richmond.)

Prices listed below are what Caviar charges. Comparing this to Calibur's online menu, prices are the same.

*Quarter pounder: 1/4 pound patty served with caramelized onions, lettuce, tomato, pickle and house made ketchup ($6.95), add Heinz ketchup (free), Dijon mustard (free), Jalapeno (+$0.50), Mushroom (+$1.50), Bacon (+$2), Cheddar cheese (+$1.50)
*Half pounder: 1/2 pound patty served with caramelized onions, lettuce, tomato, pickle and house made ketchup ($9.50), add Raw yellow onion (free), Heinz ketchup (free), Mayo (free), Jalapeno (+$0.50), Egg (+$1.50), Bacon (+$2), American cheese (+$1.50)
*Chili cheese fries ($5.95)
*Tallow fries: fries cooked in beef tallow ($3.50), add Cheddar ($1.50)

I got the quarter pounder. It was a little overcooked as I ordered my burger medium rare, but I was more bummed that they didn't put onions, lettuce, tomato and pickles in it. Both Caviar and Calibur's menus state they come standard with each burger. So where were my veggies?! I liked the flavors of the burger, but it wasn't the same without those ingredients.

The fries were good. Crispy on the outside and soft inside, but I wouldn't waste the money to add cheese. It was just shredded cheese melted on top. Most of it melted on the bottom of the paper dish, so it wasn't very cheesy. I wish they used cheese sauce instead. The chili fries were okay. I don't like beans, so I didn't really eat that much of this.

I had a bite of the roommate's burger and really liked his half pounder. It was cooked medium rare as requested, so nice and juicy. And it was more flavorful than mine with the onion and egg. It made it feel more like a burger. Though his was still missing the listed veggies.

Given the burger prices add up with toppings, I was expecting to get the basic toppings. Turning what could have been a 4 star review into 3.
author: Elena N.

description:
Burger is very good! Fries are good but not great. I will definitely be back!!!
Bread, patty and are very good! Very fresh and not greasy at all!
author: Greg R.

description: Going down hill with the quality and flavor not sure what happened but dry And thin not thick and juicy anymore.
author: Keli D.

description: Love this place! Very good burgers and fries and the staff is just so so nice! Perfect spot to pick up lunch if you are headed to Peek-a-boo or a movie.
author: Jessica P.

description: Great food and experience. Tasty burgers and the best fries. Pleasant employees who keep the place clean. Love the 70s Rock-n-roll. Someone there has great taste in music. I'm glad I stopped in and will be going back soon. Parking all along W. Portal Ave.
author: She B.

description: So I saw the guy working there give an extra shake to a girl who ordered happy hour special... she wasn't finished with her shake but he gave her another one to go.  I also ordered the happy hour special and when my daughter wanted to take one to go he said "$6.50" I asked about the happy hour special and the guy said "you're not finished yet" I said "you just gave a shake to the other girl who didn't finish her shake" he turned around and started making a shake and looked back at me saying "this ain't for you". What's the point of happy hour if you only get 1 regular serving?? Btw he also gave the other customer a bag of fries to go!!!???!  But we were not given the same level of customer service.  We paid for our food as well.  Super rude experience and got ripped off as well! $26 for kid burger, 1/4 burger with fries and a drink!?!?!
author: Sheree A.

description:
Most of the time when we make our trek to San Francisco, my hubby and I are pretty certain we will eat good food. So when our craving for burgers ignited, we decided Calibur may be the exact spot we had been searching for. 

While I love mostly everything about the city, the one thing I DESPISE most of all is the FREAKIN' PARKING. My poor hubby drove around the area for at least 40 minutes trying to find a free spot. Finally, the Gods of Parking felt sorry for us and gave us a spot that was about two blocks away. Normally I would frown at the distance, but I was too dang hungry to care. 

Calibur itself is a pretty small building that is longer than it is wide. Decorations are bare since they seem to rely more on simplicity than anything else. To order burgers, you pick the size of the burger (quarter pounder, third pounder, and half pounder) and any additional toppings on top of the typical tomatoes, lettuce, and pickles. 

We both got the third pounder, but I added an egg and mushrooms while my hubby added cheese and bacon. We also got garlic fries to share. First off, the prices are EXORBANT here. The burgers without any add-ons are already about $9 and any additional topping is at least $1. The fries were an additional $6 and before you know it, the final price rang up to $30. For burgers!? Crazy... 

The food came out fast and looked very impressive at first glance. The burgers were piled on like a mountain and the fries were long, thick, and crispy. I made the mistake of undoing the wrapper around my burger and ended up making a big, big mess. The meat in both of our burgers were hot and juicy, tasting great with the crispy bun. I loved having the egg on mine and my hubby said his bacon was fried well. But unfortunately, the hot meat was terribly cooled by the icy cold tomatoes and lettuce. I was so disappointed! How could they serve cold tomatoes on a hot burger? Absolute atrocity! 

But their fries... WOWEE! They know how to make their garlic fries right. It just didn't have the taste of garlic, it was COVERED in actual roasted garlic and thyme that made for a mouth-watering side. Super impressed with those! It did come with a fresh tomato sauce, but that was cold as well. What a bummer... 

So while Calibur serves gigantic burgers, for the prices, it really can't do anything less. The fries were phenomenal, but serving food with cold ingredients was such a shame. The verdict? I guess even San Francisco has its fair share of sub-par eateries.
author: Quyen L.

description: Been here a few times over the last few months.  Usually go here b/c my son likes the burgers.  The burgers are average. If I would compare them they would be similar to an in n out burger except the buns at Calibur are much better.  The fries are also ok and not too greasy.  When I was there last they were short staffed but they managed to get the burgers I ordered to go fairly fast. Staff were  very friendly. Also, note they do have bathrooms and they are clean.  Overall, I would give them a 3.5.  Things to improve would probably be: slightly lower cost for burger, a juicier beef patty or maybe offering something else like a buffalo burger.
author: Mike S.

description: I placed three separate orders with Caliber. Each time I was craving a good burger and fries. The burgers are consistently good, tasty, made well, and they don't fall apart or make you feel greasy and sick after. I'm glad there is a good burger joint near where I live. Can't recommend this place enough.
author: Christian H.

description: Visiting family in the Bay Area and they took my husband and I to Calibur, SO delicious! Very friendly staff and amazing food. Definitely recommend the Calibur ketchup!
author: Cortney M.

description:
Ordered two burgers on the caviar app. They totally hit the spot- we wanted medium rare so we ordered "rare" bc we thought they would cook in delivery. It was the right move!

You could really taste the quality of the beef; Them patties were juicyyyyyy!!! They were way bigger than expected, so next time probably won't get a double double. 

Can't wait to enjoy again!  Prices were very reasonable!
author: Shay K.

description: I'd only come here if I was really hungry and didn't have any other choices. The burger is fine. The fries are just okay. Nothing special about this place. They do have locally made sodas and gluten free bread. They also have their own rendition of animal style fries, which was the Calibur style, but it was just okay. The staff is friendly, but I'd only go there if I really just wanted a burger, was in the area, and didn't feel like going anywhere else. For how much it is, it isn't really worth it.
author: Julie L.

description:
When I saw all the reviews for Calibur, I was excited for a new burger place, but then I saw it was in West Portal, which is quite the trip from where I am.

THEN, I saw that they deliver. I swear this is probably the best burger you can delivered. There's a huge selection for customizing your burger, and the (both tallow and calibur) fries are amazing, too! The quality is amazing, and with a focus on organic beef, the price is perfect! 

I've even had their milkshakes, which are perfect! Not too sweet, which is my preference!

I can't wait to eat here in person, soon, hopefully!

Food: 9/10
Value: 9/10
Overall: 9/10
author: Evan K.

description:
Love the burgers and the French fries.  My kids love the shakes.  The food is seriously good and my friends love the veggie burgers (I may have to try one myself sometime!)

Today when we ate, my son dumped half his burger on the ground while eating.  The owner refused to have us clean it up, and instead cleaned it up himself.  He then gave my son a whole new burger.  It was totally unnecessary, but one of the nicest things anyone has ever done for me at a restaurant.  

I should note that this type of service is the norm there.  Would recommend this place to families as the kids burger/fries combo is a bargain.
author: Jay G.

description: Came here today at 5pm and got a single patty hamburger (7$) and a vanilla milkshake. The bill total was about 15$. Both were pretty good and definitely satisfied my cravings. Their milkshake wasn't too sweet like in & out which I enjoy. I would definitely come back whenever I'm in the area. Service was good. The place is filled with tables and chairs so there's place to sit if u decided to eat it there.
author: Tina C.

description:
Calibur is really a great little place! Clean, friendly, using fresh local (and grass fed beef) ingredients. You can build your own burger, or opt for the Calibur burg, which includes beef, lettuce, tomato, grilled onions and secret sauce.

Their house made veggie burger is truly excellent. And to top everything off - their food is packaged in environmentally friendly materials that can go straight into the composter when you are done with your to-go meal.

There are a couple of tables outside where you can dine with your pup, if desired. And - the young people working there are really a treat - kind and hard-working. A home-run.
author: Amy B.

description: I ordered online via grubhub.  It is MILES above even McD's gourmet "signature" meals. I was surprised they came on time since I live in the outer Mission which is so far from West Portal. Their burger is big & tasty & warm and not at all artificial tasting.  Their Calibur fries was a mountain of oozy tasty melted cheesy sauce and tender marinated onions.  Their shake was not too sweet.  Ooooh....like heaven for lunch!!! If only they had burgers & fries like that in the Outer Mission!!! I'll be back to order from them!
author: Frugal C.

description:
Came here with my boyfriend. The burger was amazing!!! I ordered the kids which came with fries, and that was perfect!!! They also had ranch which was amazing! The ranch cost extra but the portion and the taste was amazing!!! The order came fast, there were a decent amount of parking. The fries were good, but could have been hotter. This place is great as you order the basic and then you can add on anything. There is a 4 dollar for any three extra toppings. I got the fried egg, cheese and mushrooms. For the kids burger the add ons were half off. 

The music that played in the shop was great. It was a cozy little place. They also have great milk shakes with a special every month. For one 1/3 lb burger and add ons plus a kids burger with fries and add ons the price came out to be about 24 dollars.
author: Amy Y.

description: This place is everything! Order everything!  The shake is big enough to split between two people. The garlic fries are on point! Burgers are so good!
author: Jessica C.

description:
The burgers are ok. Their Calibur sauce is basically their version of the In n Out sauce. Their ingredients are fresh, other than their burger patties. The burger I got seemed like it was a frozen patty. I could be wrong, but there was a taste difference for sure! 

What I did like was their garlic fries. Nice and garlicy! I also got their black and white milk shake, which was awesome! I mean, nothing special, but it really hit the spot! Not too thick, but definitely a little bit of work to get it through the straw!
author: Aaron Y.

description:
Good burgers, good fries, good service, good decor. Not cheap, but about right for what you'd find in the area. Besides, it's not a greasy spoon; it's a hipster's dream of a greasy spoon, and that puts a little premium on it.

But dollar refills? Fountain soda typically costs a restaurant peanuts to sell. The price the customer pays is 95% profit. I figure there's one reason this place sees sense in also selling Diet Coke by the can and it's because two cans costs the customer less than a fountain soda and a refill! Makes no decent sense.
author: Oliver K.

description:
The interior is reminiscent of the old-style diners. I ordered the single burger w/ American cheese calibur style and my BF ordered the double burger w/ cheese & jalapeño. Both were okay but I wish there was more of the sauce, which the workers were nice enough to hand out more of. The jalapeños were so small (there were only 2) that we thought they forgot it. I don't think the sides are worth the money (0.75-$1.50) if they don't give you a lot of it..

The garlic fries were also just ok. The garlic should've been cooked thru a bit more to bring out more of its flavor.
author: Emily L.

description:
Calibur is one of the better burger places that I've been to lately. Burgers aren't hard to make, but while some places give you a stunning job, most fail miserably. Thank goodness Calibur did not fail.

I can tell immediately if I will begin to like the burger by its bun. Just like a good laptop needs a good keyboard, a good burger absolutely needs a good bun. Thusly,

SINGLE BURGER ($6.49+$0.50 for cheese)
THE BUN: had excellent volume, immaculate tan color with a slightly shiny exterior, and was dense (dare I say a bit too dense), but otherwise was very refreshing compared to many other burger places that I've been to.

THE MEAT: was a little boring, but seasoned with justice. I got the single burger so maybe I should've gotten the double burger.

THE CONTENTS: roma tomatoes and lettuce were fresh. Onions and melted cheese (adds a few dolla extra) weren't bad. 

ALSO TRIED

GARLIC FRIES ($4.49): kinda boring fries with a smidgen of fried garlic. I suggest that they add more.
CHILI CHESSE FRIES ($4.49): the same boring fries with chili and cheese. Nothing special but it was OK.

AMBIANCE: 4 stars cause it's a nice little place in West Portal with plenty of seats on a Thursday night.
SERVICE: 4 stars they bring it to your table which is nice. 
FOOD: 4 stars since it was a solid burger.
PRICE: 4 stars not bad for a solid burger!

Bottom Line: need a solid burger in West Portal? Here's your your place. I recommend it!
author: Andrew C.

description: Exceptional services! The waiter came around with his wavy iPad and ordered our food; especially, with a group of 20 ppl. The food was expedited profoundly well and my burger was made too my perfection! Most definitely, this place was the spot for some mouth watering burgers!
author: Teresa C.

description: Great burgers and love the online ordering from iPhone. Tons of add-on. The delivery was fast and the burgers were still very warm. Great fries as well.
author: Alex C.

description: Looking for a good quality burger, look no further than Calibur.  The atmosphere is super chill and relaxed. The service is fast and friendly. It is a no frills kind of restaurant, but the food quality is very good. The menu is fun and offers great variety. Plus they have soft serve! Great spot for kids. They pretty much had me at organic beef and that delicious brioche bun! Seriously, the burgers here are better than at more pricey restaurants in the city.
author: Halima T.

description: Their customer service is PHENOMENAL!  I had a minor issue and Jorge and Seán were so quick to get back to me and help problem solve which I really appreciated.  We've had to fly in and out of SF for personal reasons and we'd happily visit this establishment again
author: Jenna C.

description:
I passed by Calibur a lot and made a mental note to check it out later. I finally did. 

I ordered a burger with cheddar and caramelized onions and an order of tallow fries. My boyfriend ordered the same thing but with bacon. He probably should have gone with the $4 combo for toppings but didn't think about it. 

The quality of the food was good, but the taste was not there for me in the burger. Ordering bacon might have been a good option for me to add some more flavor. The tallow fries looked appealing, but I would have wanted more garlic. What are garlic fries if you don't leave reeking of garlic? The sauce it came with was not bad. 

Overall, not a bad place. Food quality is great but I would not list this as a favorite burger joint. I'd like to try their veggie burger and a milkshake next time.
author: Sofia R.

description: If I need a good cheeseburger, this is my first choice. Great location right by West Portal Station, friendly staff, good music, and the burgers are of course incredible. I even hoarded their house ketchup for a while!
author: Shanks G.

description: A great post school lunch with our oldest 6th grader who LOVES burgers!  Burgers are very tasty, fries are delicious and the owners are great people.
author: Jarlath O.

description:
I stopped by Calibur for the first time last week and I ordered a cheese burger with mushrooms + fries. Delicious! great ambience and really friendly staff :)
Will repeat for sure!
author: Ferran T.

description:
This is an exceptionally good, if not superb, burger restaurant. 

This was our first time here, due to my oldest son.s recommendation. The owner persistently checked back with us to make sure we had everything we needed. 

The Calibur fries were delicious, as were the regular fries. The burger's patties were cooked adequately with no red inside. If you want your burger medium rare or medium, you might want to ask about that up front. 

The build your own burger manner of ordering produces a custom burger for each client. You can also order it for brunch with an organic egg. The hamburger meat is high quality and tastes great.

Don't forget a shake or a malt. They are thick and delicious.

Enjoy!.
author: Reyn J.

description: Tasty Burger. I would say 4 stars, however, I'll give it 5 stars because the staff was so nice. The Burger was cooked perfect. Very juicy. I really enjoyed the bun as well. I would definitely come back
author: Kevin S.

description: Ordered Calibur off Amazon food delivery and the food came right on time and the burger/fries were really great. Burger was delicious and not messy and the fries were a bit cold, but otherwise the meal was great. Will definitely order again!
author: Ryan S.

description: The food is absolutely amazing and comes out really quickly. The burgers are juicy and large, the milkshakes are thick and not too sweet and the perfect size, and the fries are crispy and hot. AND all the food is 100% organic. The service is definitely 10 out of 10 and I have not been disappointed yet. After I stopped being a vegetarian, I still hesitated eating burgers, but these burgers make me crave them all the time. It's like fireworks on my tastebuds! And on top of that, they have pretty awesome T-shirt's.
author: Sky G.

description:
I stopped by on a Saturday afternoon with my 12-year-old as he wanted a burger place in the area. We were there for a late lunch - around 2:30pm - although there were still several people inside. We decided what we wanted fairly quickly, and got sodas from their machine, which were from a local place, and were quite good - not as sweet as most sodas but quite tasty. 

Our orders arrived very quickly - the man who brought our burgers out to us said that as soon as we ordered, he started cooking. The burgers were perfect - all burgers are cooked medium (although I am sure you can specify otherwise) but this is exactly how I like mine cooked, with a little pink in the middle but still juicy. The only thing I added to the "calibur style" was pickles. We added an order of garlic fries, which is good for two. There's also "calibur style" fries, which seemed like animal fries at In-n-Out, but higher quality. 

I thought the prices were reasonable for what we got, and the service was excellent. 

My 12-year-old loved his burger too. We will definitely go back for the shakes next time we're near West Portal.
author: Lori M.

description:
Excellent Menu! So dee~lish! Owner & Employees are so nice! Very clean and modern with cool 1950's charm.
But 1 less star because I felt they prioritized Über-Food-Delivery-Orders over dine-in-customers.
A tad pricey; $55.00 for 2 burgers, 2 fries, and 2 shakes.
I will for sure return for their happy hour though!
author: You H.

description:
3.5? - The burger was just OK to me 

I am a HUGE burger fan. I really like that they support organic movement. You can taste the freshness of their food. Freshness shouldn't replace flavor tho and mine was a bit lacking. I added bacon and avocado. The bread was a bit too sweet to my liking too. I think my burger came out to be $16 with regular fries which is steep for a burger. 

Wasn't a fan of their ketchup, needed to load up on my personal preference Heinz.
author: Jess W.

description: Great burger and sincere customer service. Would definitely come back for a burger, fries and shake.
author: Raymond B.

description: Saturday 10/28/17 around 4:25pm. When asked if there it would take long if I ordered a burger, the tall y young caucasian male with longish blonde hair exhibited an incredibly condescending attitude.  Perhaps he was having a bad day but if I were the management at Calibur I I would be mortified.  It's bad for business and Calibur certainly didn't get mine because of it.
author: Jed S.

description: Pretty solid I thought.  Not as good as super duper, but better than other fast casual spots.  Interesting soda fountain with local drinks made with real sugar cane.
author: Hutch C.

description: Organic Cali beef with a retro diner feel. Who could ask for more? Caliber made my Wednesday night this week. Thanks!
author: Adam O.

description: From 4 to 5 stars. Just ate at Calibur again tonight with my family, and it's always great, every time. Service and food are top notch. Everything in my old review still applies, and I'm bumping it up a star, a rare 5--star review for me, because the goodness of this place is just so darn consistent. And really, in the beginning, I thought it was a bit pricey but now it's pretty standard prices for great ORGANIC fare and very attentive service -- and I don't have to suffer through some ridiculously prepared hipster burger! I'm so glad my family lives just a few minutes away from Calibur.
author: Jason G.

description:
Tried it last night. Great customer service! The burger comes with the housemade sauce, pickles, Carmelized onions, lettuce, pickles, tomatoes. For $4 you can add 3 extra toppings, naturally I chose a fried egg, bacon, and cheese.  My husband got a gluten free bun that he said was good. 

The tallow fries are really good! I didn't care for the housemade sauce only because I wanted the ketchup taste but the sauce is more like a marinate. It's purely preference because on its own, the sauce is tasty.
author: bree m.

description: I thoroughly enjoyed my juicy grass fed burger here. I gotta say it's one of the best burgers I've tried. And with the sauce and some mustard on the side. I wouldn't have done a thing different. The meat tasted clean and fed right. It was juicy and extremely succulent. The meat was the highlight of this burger. Great location. Friendly staff. This isn't a place where you'll be pampered with top notch service. This is a place that's a bit more laid back. Get your own napkins. And enjoy your burger inside or outside. Perfect for that day you're ready to cheat on your diet like I did. And I'll tell ya, I didn't regret a single bite. Still dont
author: Karina G.

description:
Decided to cruise down to the West Portal area since I usually don't have any business in this part of town, however I do know the strip is home to many good restaurants. Parked the ride, pulled out my phone and opened up this trendy little app that all the cool kids are using to find local businesses that we love to support. 

I figured I would give Calibur a shot. Walking in it felt like I was squeezing into a subway station that has the most amazing burger and garlic fry smells coming from the kitchen in the back and waft towards you while you stare at the menu trying to decide what you want to eat. 

The menu is pretty cut and dry... Want a burger, great... How large of a burger would you like? Quarter, third or half pounder? They also have a veggie burger that I hear is pretty damn good as well. Then you choose your toppings, they have five options on the board for you to choose from cheese (cheddar, american or swiss, bacon,egg, mushrooms and avocado, ranging in price from $1.50-$2.00 with bacon being the most expensive. Or you can choose 3 toppings of your choice for $4. 

They do have standard toppings that come on your burger that make it "Calibur style" those include caramelized onions, Calibur sauce (a homemade ketchup that tastes more like a marinara sauce), lettuce, tomatoes and pickles. I personally went with a third pounder with cheddar cheese and done up "Calibur Style" of course with the s.o.s. (sauce on side) please! Also ordered some garlic fries and took a seat. 

About 10 mins later there was a monster of a burger sitting before me and I thought to myself, let's see how far we can get with this one before its time to call it quits. The guy who brought the burger out reminded me to be careful as Calibur burger's are juicy and he was not lying about that. The burger was cooked to perfection, seasoned just right and all of the ingredients tasted fresh as could be, all stuffed between a light and fluffy brioche bun.

The garlic fries were crispy and were coated in finely chopped garlic and a rosemary and thyme seasoning that packed a punch. I read that they fry them in a mixture of beef tallow (a fancy way of saying beef fat) and rice bran oil. They did not seem greasy and they were definitely crunchy. 

I was over all pleased with this visit and will give it another try in the future as it was a pleasant way to chill and scarf down a burger (yes, I ended up eating it all) while watching college football on their flat screen mounted above the entry way. 

Great service, and a tasty burger and fries... What more can you ask for?
author: Josh H.

description: Totally sucks. First they didn't put mayo on my burger and I asked for it. Second, I asked if they can cook the fried egg over hard. And the lady at the counter says they can. Nope! Not cooked all the way. The burger is supposedly be medium well. Burger was cooked well done. No taste in the burger and taste really dry. That's too bad. I was hoping to have a good experience. But sadly I won't be back here again
author: Eric C.

description:
I suppose I should be disappointed that Ryan Scott's Market & Rye closed up shop for this upscale burger spot, but I'm really not. Don't get me wrong, I mean I think a place that serves full-portion artisan salads deserves to thrive, but I'm the type that can't be trusted at a salad bar. I don't mean I sneeze into the protective glass guard or anything, but I ladle on the unhealthy toppings like nobody's business. I'm lucky if I see a lettuce leaf underneath all the bacon bits, candied pecans and ranch dressing. That sorta describes my experience at Market & Rye. I single-handedly defeated its purpose, but I guess I can always find redemption at its surviving location in Potrero Hill. Anyway it's all about the burger now. It's owned by two young guys who obviously gave a lot of thought to their food.

After all, they hand-grind the fresh meat and hand-cut the potatoes. They also use Three Twins ice cream in their milkshakes. And that's all they do if you don't count the chopped salad option. Which I don't. It's the In-N-Out model, and I respect it. I hate when fast food places diversify beyond reason. I call that the Jack-in-the-Box syndrome: offer too many things and do all of them badly. But no they stick with the basics, and I decided to go whole hog that evening. I ordered the &9.50 Half Pounder and added Cheese ($1.50), Bacon ($2) and Mushroom ($1.50), so that amounts to $14.50 and I haven't even left the burger yet. A Regular $3.50 order of Fries please. Y'see? I showed discretion by not going for the Large. But I did go for the $5.95 Strawberry Milkshake. I had to, it's a house specialty, right? RIGHT?? And so the wait began.

I sat myself at a lone table next to the front window, and about 15 minutes elapsed. In the meantime, I found myself trapped by the hand railing and a bevy of fat-bottom girls who barricaded themselves with their iPhones at the next table. The food finally arrived. The burger was ridiculously huge and camouflaged by the butcher paper wrapping (photo: http://bit.ly/1sNBQa5). Pricey sure but juicy and delicious with all the right accessories. Next time I'm downsizing to the Quarter Pounder. The fries were hot and plentiful though a bit too oily for my taste, and I have oily taste (photo: http://bit.ly/1wnrn5R). The milkshake was thick and abundant (photo: http://bit.ly/ZFSSMK). Brain freeze ahead. They gave me a complimentary bottle of water when they saw me gorging. Egad, I'm full. Girls, please...I need to go.

FOOD - 4 stars...juicy, pricey burger plus finger-burning fries & a thick shake with plenty of extra
AMBIANCE - 2.5 stars...busy and hard to navigate, a poor layout for eating on your own
SERVICE - 4 stars...friendly and attentive even if the wait was a bit long
TOTAL - 4 stars...I probably should have an artisan salad but a big burger now and then would be forgivable, right? RIGHT?
author: Ed U.

description:
It's harder to find a restaurant that will get the temperature right of a burger than a steak.  Calibur does it right!  We passed by and went in since he has been wanting to check it out since he heard of it opening.  And turns out they just opened today at 4pm.  

Calibur uses all organic California products.  They keep it simple with only four burger options - 1/4 lb, 1/3 lb, 1/2 and a veggie burger.  Toppings are $1.50 each.  They keep the menu simple with chili fries or regular fries, one kids meal and a chopped salad and shakes.  Prices are slightly higher than most burger places.  1/4lb ($6.95) and 1/3 ($8.50).  We also shared a regular order of fries ($3.50).  Standard ingredients are lettuce, tomatoes, special sauce, & caramelized onions.  Cheddar, blue and American are options for cheeses.  

The bun was thick but enjoyable.  As mentioned our beef was cooked just right, medium and juicy!  You can tell everything is made fresh here. Loved the carmelized onion.  Nicely melted cheddar too.  The special sauce was ketchup like but slightly different taste and texture wise.  Fries were golden brown and well seasoned but the portion was small for the price.  He said if the meat was seasoned more the burger would have made a bigger impact.  

Definitely a four for the time being in my book.  He likes the simplicity of a good burger and sometimes I like the simplicity of not having too many options to choose from on a menu because I'm so indecisive!  Will be back!
author: Cat C.

description:
Not impressed. With all the excellent burger choices in SF I was expecting something magical. No fairytale endings here. 

Pros: 
Organic food
Service was good
Large television
Excellent house made sweet ketchup
Hearty chili 

Cons:
The burger was tooooo juicy. Yes! Tonight I experienced that too juicy of a burger does exist and it's a negative quality. 
Bacon was meager
$6 milkshake had zero flavor. Zero. Tasted like sweet water. 

Here's the deal: if you're selling a $6 milkshake, it should blow me out of the water. Remember in Pulp Fiction when Vincent Vega asks Mrs. Mia Wallace if the $5 milkshake she ordered had liquor in it since it was so outrageously expensive? That's how I felt receiving this milkshake except in Pulp Fiction Vincent says "it was worth $5 cause it's pretty fucking good" - this milkshake I can say is not.
author: Rosalyn W.

description:
They charge anywhere from 0.50-1.50 for each extra topping that is not the standard lettuce, tomatoes, onions. The burger itself is pretty so so. The bread is thick but doesn't hasn't much taste to it and feels sort of dry. The nice thing though beside each extra topping being charge is that they have a nice variety of extra topping like: sautéed mushrooms and eggs.

We ordered garlic the fries themselves were good but there was not much garlic on it. I'd recommend just ordering regular fries so you don't have to pay for the very little amount of garlic they give you.

Also note that they have great ranch, although they charge extra for that too. 

In terms of parking it's quite hard, and you end up having to park in the residential areas parallel to the street which Calibur is on.

Overall I'm okay with them charging extra for every extra toppings, if their burgers matched a higher bar.
author: Derrick C.

description: I ordered from DoorDash, which can be a risk. But this was well worth it! The bun, out does super duper, the veggies, the meat were all so fresh! The the price is good! I will be back!
author: Cory T.

description: I really really loved my burger at Calibur! Having bookmarked this place awhile back after hearing how much my friends  loved here, I was pumped to finally make the journey out to West Portal for dinner.  Calibur has a simple menu, and I'm glad for that.  Menus that are complex and filled with options overwhelm me! Calibur serves up organic beef burgers, coupled with fries that are cooked in beef tallow.  I decided to go with the single burger, fully loaded with caramelized onions, lettuce, tomato, Calibur sauce. I also topped off my burger with avocado for an extra $1.50.  I normally don't eat a whole order of french fries on my own, but since I was "researching," I went with the full order.  The burger was glorious, and I made sure I finished EVERY.THING. Leave no waste behind! The fries were amazing, and 100x better than anything I've had an In-N-Out.  The only part about Calibur that was so-so on was their housemade ketchup.  I can't quite put my finger on what's in it, but it's got an ovelry herb-y taste that doesn't correlate with french fry eating.  Heinz is still the best way to go, in my opinion.  I definitely will be back here when I find myself out in West Portal again!
author: Lisa I.

description: Tried this place twice, first time wasn't very memorable. Second time, meat was really dry and probably won't be remembered again. Looked like it was cooked well done and not medium well as stated.  I couldn't taste the sauce at all and the bun overpowered everything so I ended up eating the burger open faced. The extra star goes to the fresh veggies that went in it and the cheese melted on the beef patty perfectly.
author: annie w.

description: My wife and I love this burger spot. They use organic grass fed meat patties. We always order the burgers, garlic fries, and milkshake. There customer service is great!
author: PremiumShotz P.

description: Excellent burger! Love the sauce and bun, caramelized onions on the burger. Tallow fries are yummy. No after taste either. Haven't tried the milkshake - next on my list. Definitely going back soon. Not cheap food but well worth the price.
author: Jamie L.

description: was craving a burger so we tried this place out. I got mine calibur style with red onions instead of the grilled, it was pretty yummy except I agree the bread is pretty thick and a little overbearing. I think if it were more toasted or warm all the way thru it would be a bit better? the top of the bun wasn't warm so that was a bummer. my other half got the same burger with bacon and grilled onions that one tasted a bit better. they have craft soda machine from a company out of alameda; refills are a $1 on fountain drinks. they also have canned sodas and bottle ones as well and milkshakes but those run like $6 I believe. a little pricey but everything is organic and fresh.
author: E S.

description: First off the burger was amazing. It was so juicy. I got a single burger with american cheese, calibur style. It tasted really fresh and idk how to explain how amazing this burger was but it was amazing. Second the fries were amazing. I love fries, I am a fries person. These fries did not disappoint.
