Third, the soda was bomb. I never drink soda but I had a sip of my boyfriend and it was great, so great I finished his. The brand is Alameda Point Craft Soda so it's a local bay area company which is also great. Fourth, we came on a rainy day so it was pretty empty but the workers were nice and they actually check up on you which is always nice. As a bonus that day we got free cookies made by the manager (not too sure) and they tasted amazing. They were big, soft, and chewy which is always a plus. I would definitely come again and I will definitely reccomond this place to everyone. ^__^
author: Mary-Angeline L.

description:
Just had fries. Ok. Crisp. 

Why two stars? It's hard to give more. They cook it all in the back. Can't see a thing, I'm not saying it's bad. I'm just saying I want to see into the kitchen these days. Their website is all sparkle so I assumed this place would reflect it. It doesn't. It's fake 50's decor is done on the cheap which makes it look sad.  Bummer. Cheap Nostalgia it is.
author: Nik D.

description: So so so good. Classic burgers. Great taste. They keep it simple which is what I prefer. Get a single burger and ad bacon. I think of it as a higher-end in-n-out
author: Joe P.

description:
yummy food, clean and spacious place!

also, staff are very friendly. Must try their sauce!
author: Albia C.

description: House-ground, 100% organic, grass-fed California beef. Favorite side is cheddar fries. Homemade organic tomato ketchup. Draft sodas, fun flavors. Attentive service. Can sit outside.
author: Bronwyn G.

description: We order here a lot through Grubhub. I think it's a good solid burger and quite consistent. Fries are also yummy. We get the cheeseburger with our different toppings and have ordered the grilled cheese once- which I can't really remember. Anyway, we will continue to eat here!
author: Dbs B.

description:
Was stoked to check this place out, but probably won't waste my time. Place closed early on a Friday night because they ran out of bread. There are two places to buy bread within a block from there. 

Just go to in n out, or bullshead if you need a burger within walking distance.
author: Alex P.

description:
Amazing burgers at a reasonable price with excellent service.

I had the single burger wth everything, fries and chocolate shake. 

Burger comes with special sauce that adds nice flavor. They give you a side of custom made ketchup sauce (different the Heinz) I really liked it. Chocolate shake was thick but not too thick great tasting. Overall awesome burger joint, will most likely be coming back!
author: Colby J.

description:
I've never had a burger where the bread was so good that it overshadowed the rest of the burger. Also, "house-made ketchup" is always something that sounds good, but when you find that the regular ketchup thing is completely empty, that should tell you something.

I came here with the best friend because I hadn't realized that I completely skipped lunch by accident. It was 4pm. Oops. They were also having a Harry Potter special: Butterbeer milkshakes. Obviously, this had to happen no matter what.

The staff was friendly and made sure to inform me that the wait time for this special milkshake would be 10 minutes. No big deal, since I needed actual food and not just delicious Potter-inspired dessert beverages. I ordered a burger with cheese and their house-made ketchup, no special sauce because it had mayo that I'm allergic to, garlic fries, and said Butterbeer milkshake.

Food arrived quickly. As I mentioned in the first sentence...holy moly. Best burger bun I have ever had in my entire life. The rest of the burger...um...not so great. I don't know what it was about the house-made ketchup, but it was awful. Best friend also had the same reaction and we were both pretty bummed that the Heinz dispenser was completely out (but as best friends, I was given the last of the ketchup that could be dispensed. Seriously, best friendship right there). The burger was strange. It was...steamed? It was...cold? I don't know how it was cooked, but it lacked the wonderful grease that you order a burger for in the first place. It felt like Chris Traeger in Parks & Rec was trying to make a burger with Ron Swanson's advice, and then tried to make it "just a bit healthier". That is not what I want in my burger.

The fries were pretty good. Super garlicky af which is a necessity and quite delicious. The Butterbeer milkshake? Surprisingly good. I felt bad for them since it was obviously a pain to make. It had butterscotch pudding, Butterfinger bits, vanilla ice cream. Stuff like that. It was a nice thick shake, but slightly difficult to get through the straw

All in all, a good place, but I've never been so upset by a burger before. I'd only come back for a shake and fries. And maybe the bun on its own, if they'll give that to me.
author: Robbin A.

description:
+/- THE FOOD
I had the quarter pounder burger, cooked medium rare, with extra mushrooms. The patty was actually fully cooked (or nowhere near medium rare) but still was juicy. Toppings included lettuce, tomato, grilled onions, and pickles. The grilled mushrooms were a great add on to provide a bit more flavor. The bun was nice and crispy. Overall, the taste of the burger was decent because it wasn't SUPER good but you could tell there was a lot of effort put into it to make it look aesthetically pleasing. The garlic fries were a bit strange because they added a whole bunch of rosemary on top. I wasn't a huge fan of the rosemary because it took away the garlic taste. However, the fries were extremely crunchy and fresh.
author: Cindy C.

description: The best cheesy chedder fries ever! On top of that they were super kind and had amazing service! They even offered us the leftover of a shake that had just been made (they put it in it's own cup!) I will definitely be back for a burger!
author: Nate S.

description:
Came here with the family on a Saturday evening.  I must say, their burgers were cooked perfectly!
Kids had the mini burgers which came with a good portion of fries, definitely shareable.  I had the veggie burger, and it was awesome!
author: April N.

description: Got this on doordash delivery and it arrived in perfect condition!  Really flavorful and juicy-- it really hits the spot. Veggies in the burger are really fresh and it makes a difference.  I don't think it is quite as balanced as Super Duper (they have a better bun-to-filling ratio there) but this is an extremely close second.  Next time I have a burger emergency and need a burger delivered to me stat, I will order Calibur!
author: Katie W.

description: Great place, best ingredients, fast service, made to order. A lot of care has been put into selection of the best sides, presentation (clean and simple), menu and seating. Even great homemade ketchup. Easy for families. Singles and Twosomes. About as far from McDs as you can get. Nice neighborhood of small shops and a great bookshop next door.
author: Jacqueline S.

description: We thought we had great burgers and fries.  Choice of rice bran oil or beef tallow.  Cooked just right. Not greasy.  Good local colas.  Pleasant staff.  We ate in a Monday about 3 pm.
author: Yella W.

description: Simply delicious! I've had a hard time finding a good burger with a gluten free bun that doesn't fall apart and I've finally found the spot. The burger was cooked perfectly and the meat crumbled just right with every bite. Sometimes burger patties feel stiff but not here. The gluten free bun held up to the juices of my swiss cheeseburger with caramelized onions and mushrooms. It had mouthwatering flavors. Steve very much enjoyed his regular bun American cheeseburger with bacon and caramelized onions. He thought the bun had good texture and the burger patty was juicy but not dripping wet. Neither of us got sauce on the burgers because we prefer to have it on the side so we can taste the juices and flavors of the organic ground beef. The Calibur Fries with their special sauce and caramelized onions were terrific. The Fries had the right crunch and the sauce was yummy. Calibur is in an awesome neighborhood with lots of mom and pop stores so you can make a full day  out of your visit.
author: Jen L.

description: This is one of the best burger spots in SF - I've probably eaten here over a hundred times by now and it's been consistently amazing every single time. Get an egg, bacon, and calibur sauce on your double burger and you won't regret it. The calibur fries are on point too.
author: Akshay V.

description: Super good quality burger, a cut above whatever you'll get at a fast-casual place. Well cooked and juicy for sure. The fries, shake, and homemade ketchup all both bomb, unexpectedly raise the level of the whole burger and fries combo. The burgers are pretty expansively customizable, there are plenty of things that I left off my burger that I'd love to go try another time in varying combinations. The food came out promptly, and the decor was pretty fun 50's vibe. The people behind the counter were really nice as well. That being said, the cost adds up a little over ordering a full meal (with burger toppings, I wanted avocado and bacon so that's sort of my fault) for me and my date, which I don't really mind but it's definitely not In n Out costs. I think we tend to have an idea that burgers and fries are always going to be the rock-bottom of food prices, and this was a much better than average burger and fries, and the price reflected it. Maybe I'm just not used to paying SF prices.
author: Evan P.

description: Still feel the same about the food but adding a star because the order came so quickly through the caviar app, it was all prepared well, and they have a great health score which is so important to look at in SF when so many restaurants in the city have vermin infestations.
author: Emma M.

description: Pretty good chili cheese fries. I messed up order twice. The cashier was nice about it. I ordered to for there and didn't want a drink. Then I changed my mind and wanted to go and then added a drink after wards.Sebastian was his name. Props to you even though you forgot my receipt and had to ask for it.
author: Selby C.

description: The burger was great and the service was fenomenal. Honestly though, $1 for a coke refill is a little much.
author: Alan G.

description:
This is a review for delivery.  
I thought it was a mistake at first but they do actually deliver.  It only took 30 minutes and a huge burger and fryers arrived at my house. The burger was awesome. The fries were What one should expect when having food delivered.  The food is pricey if you compare it to ground sludge burgers at Micky D's.
author: Corey Jace W.

description:
Do I really want to enter into a space that charges $6 for a vanilla milkshake and $7 for 1/4 lb burger before fixings?  
Well I felt brave today. 
I had the 1/4 lb beef burger aka "royale no cheese" burger and was able to walk away satisfied.  Only add on was thick sliced bacon.  4 stars is right on for calibur.
Pros- not a speck of gristle in the properly cooked organic beef patty.  First time ever in any burger place. Not even Hubert Keller's famous burger bar did this.  The food prep here is spot on because they hand grind the beef on site instead of buying pre packaged patties.  The beef was seasoned but not enough for my palate.   I am all about intense flavors and proper technique and temperature.  The bacon was perfectly prepped- crispy and thick. Lettuce tomato and grilled onions spot on. Nice buns Hun.  
Freshly bought brioche.  
Cons- the tables were not self bussed or staff bussed properly.    Unsure on the policy here. If diners can self bus so the next diner up can use the spot it needs to be clearly indicated.  I had to wipe off a leftover chunk of beef on my table. The only clean and unoccupied one after I ordered my burger.  The staff was friendly and but not very engaging. 
If you want to be high end, make it a total dining experience and chat it up folks !
$6 for a 3 twins ice cream milkshake people. 
And with the extras you can easily hit $20+ for a big burger!
JYW likes but I would say kick it up another level and make it a 5 star Yelp Elite approved dining experience.
author: Jeff W.

description: The burgers here are absolutely delicious, and the staff were as friendly as can be!  As an added bonus, they also have wifi and outlets which is more than you can say about many coffee shops!
author: Sean P.

description: Always happy to come across those who make a valiant effort to be organic. Food taste so much better and body feels great. Place is fashioned after old school burger joint. Keep up the good work. We will continue to come back
author: Daniel H.

description: My boyfriend moved into San Francisco and one day we decided to go on a "foodie adventure" and I'm so thankful we came to this place. We've been coming here for almost a year now and within the past year, we've eaten here at least once a week. This place is AMAAAAAAZING! Everything about it is, whether it's the food, music, and the staff. I don't know how, but the food gets so much better every time we go, and we go a lot! Calibur is all I think about and I feel bad for my boyfriend but he's so kind enough to fulfill my food cravings. Thank you, Calibur, for creating an environment we always get so excited to come to.
author: Elizabeth V.

description: Decent burgers, decent fries - not great vibe. Kid friendly and they seem to like it so.....
author: Rex L.

description: I had a burger and fries and it was tasty. I thought the portions were of good size and I liked the outdoor seating. The staff was very friendly even to my little one.
author: Vanessa G.

description:
I had the vegetarian burger, and my roommate had the quarter pounder (well-done) . . . we both agreed to the fact that it was good, but that we have had much better food at other burger joints in the past . . . for example, she said that she would have way rather gone to in-n-out burger, and I personally think that I could have made a better vegetarian burger at the comfort of my home. 

the music and atmosphere of this place is cool though, super chill place to just sit down and rest & eat.
author: Brooke W.

description:
I hate being tough on new businesses but this place just sucks. 

1/4 pound burger, order of fries & a can of diet coke = $13.00.  I wanted to like this place because I live so close by and I usually give a 2nd chance, but, there's too many options on the block. 

The burger is just a burger, nothing special and the Calibur sauce tastes like pasty old tomato sauce and the fries were just fries. 

You can get a better burger up the block at Bull's Head or even La Boulange. And they both come with fries.
author: Bill L.

description:
Today's review for the choc malt milkshake.  It's a hot day and it's national ice cream day, we headed to Calibur for their 3 Twins ice cream milkshake.  I was pretty disappointed compared to the vanilla milkshake we had here the last time dine in. 
The guy had ice cream in a silver mixer cup and pulled it out of the freezer, it was pre-measured and he added the malt and milk.
But, as he was pouring it into cups for us to take-out, you could tell it just didn't have the thickness it should have for a milkshake.  It poured out like a thick soup, too watery.  The amt was way less than when I had milkshake there the last time.
There was enough malt flavor but too sweet and too watery.  Someone needs to give this guy an ice cream shake recipe, there should've been more ice cream, not getting my money's worth for $6.
author: Ry T.

description:
"Rawr..."

Me: Whoa what was that? Food Kid (Ringo M.) did you just hear that?

Ringo M.: Hear what?

"RAAAWR"

Ringo M.: Oh yea... What the hell was that?!

Twas a week before Halloween and things were getting a bit dark, eerie, and weird.

"RAAAAAWR"

Me: Didn't those beastly growls n roars come from 2 different directions?

Ringo M.: Definitely...

Out of nowhere a gigantic slimy hideous beast came quickly flying over to our table in the most horrific dominant presence... "RAAAAAAAAWR!!!"

Food Kid and I was terrified as we tried not to look it in the eyes.  I courageously took a peek between the crevice of my fingers that were protecting me from the monster.  My blurred vision slowly came to focus as I forcefully calmed my pounding heart by slowly and quietly taking deep breaths.  

I began to laugh helplessly tearing up.  I couldn't help it.  

Ringo M.: What is it?!? Why are you laughing?!

Me: Dude... Take your hands away from your face.  Seriously...

The stunned look on Food Kid's face was more priceless than a Mastercard commercial.  Damn glad he didn't see mine.

"RAAAAAAAAWR!!!" 

"RAAAAAAAAWR!!!"

Startled once again, we stared at each other with a quick moment of paralysis but it wasn't long until we started to tear up with laughter.  The beastly sounds were actually coming from our bellies, monstrous with hunger, at the site of this gigantic yolky oozy slimy cheezy beefy burger equipped with mushrooms, lettuce, tomatoes, grilled onions, pickles, avocado, 1/3 lb patty, and one mean sunny egg sandwiched between 2 nice spongey fluffy buns.  As if that wasn't enough to make our killer appetites rip through us before our mouths even got to take its very first mouth watering bite... Every ingredient was ORGANIC and the beef was GRASS FED.  No... Cows don't naturally eat corn... They eat grass.  What put this amazingly nasty burger over the top for me was instead of going for the Heinz Ketchup, I requested for their ORGANIC homemade ketchup made with sweet fresh organic tomatoes.  

That first bite... life, as the burger knew it, was over.  It vanished within minutes as I licked the last of its remains off my fingers.

This burger was seriously dressed as the perfect monster for Halloween.  I'm so freakishly impressed that I'm going to have to dress as a Calibur Burger this coming week.  My IG post of that should get me an insane amount of likes in such an Orange October.

My YUMS stamp of approval for 5 stars.
author: Colin M.

description:
Really nice staff, great burgers- fresh ingredients 
Nice addition to W, Portal area.  I like the black and white tile floor and diner style look. The menu is pretty basic ,  burgers, fries, milkshakes .  Some may find it a little pricey for a burger place , but I like it. I will be coming back.
author: Mary M.

description:
Incredible! These guys do it right! Organic. Grass Fed. Local.

I love the menu, simple is best. I had the vegetarian experience tonight but will be back to sample the rest!  It's entirely too hard to find 100% organic menus in this city. Go here, support people doing it the right way!

I was greeted with a smile, explained the menu, given recommendations and had an incredible meal. Also organic ice cream shakes?

I'm going to be a fat fat man soon.
author: Mr. H.

description:
This review is for Caviar delivery of our meal. The restaurant crew nailed it. We had three different burgers, with different toppings on each. We asked for buns on the side and Calibur called me to clarify (clear signs of intelligence there!) I told them to let the kitchen use their discretion when packing the order, to do whatever made sense.

So, they fully dressed each bun with lettuce, tomato, pickles, etc., as ordered, and then they packed the burgers with cheese and the wet toppings (like carmelized onions) on top of the meat, in separate boxes (wasteful, I know, but SO worth it!) The burgers were sitting very cleverly in little lettuce leafs, so all we had to do was lift the lettuce "sling" with the burger on it, out, and place it on the dressed buns. The fries were hot and nice and salty - duh, isn't that WHY people eat fries?

By the way, under the lettuce leafs with the burgers on them, was a TON of juice, which would have SOAKED the buns - for delivery, this is the only way to get an intact bun upon delivery and not a mushy mess. . .

Great job, Calibur! A++++ kitchen staff and smart cookies one and all. So refreshing to find intelligent people behind the scenes.
author: Chanel B.

description:
It was good but I got egg and it wasn't runny. 

It's good, pretty pricey. We got one 1/4lb and one 1/3 lb both with bacon, egg and cheese, one order of fries, a Mexican coke and a jarritos and it was $35. Just saying.
author: Katie B.

description: This place is awesome. Just what my old neighborhood needs and well placed right near the theater. The staff was wonderful. I loved how nothing had high fructose corn syrup in it ( i.e. Ketchup and soda) The owners were very warm and welcoming. My mother was extremely happy with her milkshake and burger. I had the veggie burger. Both were excellent. So glad this place is in west portal!
author: Monica G.

description:
This burger joint was just okayy... I had better. But the service was great! The burger was kind of plain in my opinion maybe because I didn't add enough toppings and the only option for condiments was ketchup. I prefer mayonnaise in my burger but it's an organic burger place so maybe that's why they don't offer mayonnaise. 

But the chili cheese fries was good!!!
author: Monica N.

description: Once again I made the mistake of grabbing a burger from this place.  My burger patties were undercooked and gave me horrible indigestion and diarrhea all night.  Steer clear
author: Kimo K.

description:
AHHH another place that doesn't know how to cook medium rare burgers T_T

BUT at least the burger was still pretty juicy and not lacking in flavor. Defiantly preferred this over BullsHead :3

Their tallow fries are very rich and flavorful. We got their garlic fries which came with rosemary. Nice touch but I felt the rosemary kind of overpowered the garlic a little bit. Would request light on the seasoning next time. I also love that they make their own ketchup because it actually tastes like tomatoes! 

I didn't get one but they make their shakes outta three twins so you know it's good!

Service was extremely friendly. Would recommend this spot if in this area for a burger (3.5 stars).
author: Melissa C.

description:
Killer burger place, simply the best. 

But the fires are show stoppers, cooked in beef fat.

Shakes are great too, and everything is completely organic.  


They also make their own ketchup which is delicious.


The best thing about this place, though, is how low key it is. The place feels like a regular burger joint. Usually high quality eateries can get pretentious with their decor, but this place is basically styled like a five guys (but with better music and a flatscreen tv). 

Awesome, we live around the corner and this is now our favorite spot.
author: Shane B.

description:
Calibur is a nice hamburger joint near the West Portal muni station. I like that they use organic ingredients, and I love the options they have like bacon, avocado, and fried egg. I think the prices for the burger is very reasonable, but the options skew towards the high side. The fries are good and the calibur toppings like grilled onions, lettuce, tomato, and sauce fills in the burger nicely. 

Be aware that about 15-20 minutes before closing time, they are take out only. Jorge and his partner run a good business and I hope they succeed at this location.
author: James N.

description:
So I just walked in here for the first time, because yes, I love burgers and as 25 year old male, I'm willing and able to slam a burger back as my first meal of the day. 

New to California, I walked around west portal and chose Calibur honestly because I saw "burger" and "$6.95." Everyone one was extremely friendly and accommodating and the owner was in and we talked burgers for a bit. He even shared the new menu which will add even more value for the buck.

I ordered the 1/3 lb burger with cheese and the works which came out to $10 even before tax. The bottom line? 

-a very tasty burger
-incredible value for the price (1/3lb)
-I was a to choose the cook temp ! (Never happens with quick burger places)
-Great bun to meat ratio, which the bun was bready and ironically at a different caliber than most quick places.
- the fries? Whole 'nother level.
author: Gino S.

description:
It's with a heavy heart that I am writing this review. I have eaten at Calibur several times and ordered delivery on many evenings. Their delivery has gone downhill and the quality of their food has as well. I ordered a burger and fries tonight from eat24. Shortly after, I got a text from eat24 that my food was on its way. So I waited. And waited. And waited some more. My delivery took over an hour and was delivered by a rude and unapologetic driver. He had someone with him, and it appeared he was more interested in socializing with friends than with how promptly my order arrived.

When I finally got my food up to my apartment, everything was stone cold - nearly inedible. 

I paid almost $20 for this meal, with the delivery fee and tip included. I am disappointed that the quality at Calibur seems to be going downhill more and more. When they first opened, I was so excited to have an organic burger place fairly close by that also delivered. But it looks like I'll have to continue to look elsewhere if I want to enjoy consistent, quality food.
author: Christine C.

description: The buns are really good, soft without being too soft. The sauce they use reminds me of what Big Mac sauce use to taste like WAY back in the 80's when it actually tasted good. The burgers themselves are delicious, and are nice and juicy. I've eaten in and I've gotten delivery through GrubHub, and every time I've loved my burger!
author: J B.

description: Ordered the veggie burger. It was fine - heavy on the beans.
author: Kayla M.

description: Went in with my dad who is vegetarian so we each had a "House Veggie, Calibur Style". It was excellent. Burgers are great but this veggie burger was outstanding. Chalk up another great eating establishment on West Portal.
author: Stephen B.

description: This burger place was absolutely delicious. I found the atmosphere to be very clean and neat, which i really liked. The interior reminded me of Five Guys. When we received our order, our burgers were very neat and juicy. I really, really enjoyed my experience there. Despite the great tasting burger, I found this place to be quite expensive. We ordered 2 burgers and and order of fries, which came out to be $25. I don't think the burgers were THAT good. Additionally, I thought the fries were just ordinary. Overall, this place was very good, but very expensive as well.
author: Amanda V.

description: The burgers are to die for. If you leave this earth without trying them at least once, you've existed but not lived. Only Dickens' could adequately describe the food here. The fries are crispy, the shakes creamy, the burgers savory. Ingredients are top shelf. From the produce to the buns, it's all fresh and carefully put together. I don't know how to describe the flavor but strongly encourage you to try this place and take the challenge to describe it. Be prepared though, no burger will measure up after this!
author: Vanessa G.

description:
I'm a huge burger slut. I am typically dedicated to my favorite burger joint of all time (Hall of Flame),  but I decided to give this new, sexy place a try. I CHEATED on Hall of Flame and I am so sorry that I did. 

I got the half pounder with egg, bacon and mushrooms. Also got chili cheese fries and regular fries... No expense can be spared when getting it on with your mistress. 

Burger: I order medium rare because I expect it to come out medium (although I'm ok with either)... It came out medium well,  if not well done. This was hugely disappointing, but the most disappointing part was my egg was cooked solid... You order an egg on a burger expecting it to ooze and fulfill your delicious, yolky fantasies. No such luck. The bacon was okay -  not extra crispy as one would hope, but more of a thicker, chewier cut. 

Fries: they sounded good in theory,  with the way they describe it on the menu, but they were nothing extraordinary. They give you a shit ton, which you think is awesome because you pay so damn much - lest we forget how cheap fries can be. 

When we got our platters, the chili cheese fries had that look they've been sitting for awhile - you know, where the cheese looks like it congealed on top? Taste - wise, it was alright...  But it tasted like a can of Trader Joe's chili with a slice of kraft cheese thrown on top.

Hubby and I ate here, with the entirety of the meal costing $40 before tip. Had it been the best burger in San Francisco, I would have gladly come back. However, with the overcooked patty, overcooked yolk and congealed cheese, I will not be back. I'd rather spend $40 somewhere else... Or better yet, $6 at In-N-Out or $10 at Hall of Flame, where their meals come with fries. 

Also, the cashier was super friendly, but the younger teenage / college kid making milkshakes is lazy. Customer complains ketchup is empty, you should probably refill the ketchup, instead of sighing heavily, as if the world is against you. 

Also, for all you organic fiends, you should probably do some research on what exactly organic means... Because that term is so loosely thrown around with everybody jumping in like cattle thinking it's super healthy. Companies price point their items higher because of the organic label hive mentality.
author: Christina B.

description:
The burgers here are amazing. Burgers are one of my top three favorite foods, so i consume them often. This place has very good tasting meat. Very authentic old-school vibe. Was my second time coming here and i teared up a little due to the enjoyment factor.

Delicious. I will be back more often.
author: Moe D.

description: Prior to eating at Calibur I didn't realize how GOOD burgers could be let alone service. Have walked by this place many times it epitomizes "a hole in the wall" gem that you're glad you came across. I got the American double which comes with two pattys and Two slices of cheese on an brioche bun. It was without question THE BEST burger I've ever eaten. To top it off I got some fries and saw their ketchup is also homemade (not the typical Heinz ketchup you get elsewhere). Also had the vanilla shake which was great just as their service was. Highly recommended, and worth every penny.
author: Kevin S.

description:
Came here with my son who wanted to try it.  They had just opened for lunch and we were both very excited to chow down on some good burgers.  

The pluses:  very friendly staff, manager or owner came out to ask if we were ok, clean place, reasonable pricing for organic food.  Fries were good. 

The minuses:  burger was luke warm and still had a raw smell, bun was not warmed or toasted.   

All in all, the burgers were not the best.  If they start serving the burgers hotter with warmed/toasted buns - it would be an A+ place with a line out the door.
author: n y.

description: Maybe it's better in person, but my delivery order was disappointing. The grilled cheese was nothing special. The cheese fries were cold and inedible.
author: Patrick S.

description: this place is refreshing because it's good, honest food, and some real comfort is given, in a nice, efficient, Eco-friendly little package. they care here. and they are hustling. you will often see the owner here, and I enjoy seeing how this place evolves to be the mainstay that it deserves to be.
author: Matt J.

description: Calibur is my go-to delivery burger (via Caviar). Delicious! They also arrive super fast, which is always a plus.
author: Amy G.

description: 3/5 burger taste, 4/5 fries taste, but 2/5 total considering the fact that they wanted $10 for the burger. The bun and other ingredients of the burger were fine, but the meat was a dry and almost chewy patty that honestly reminded me of a public school lunch burger. The fries were pretty decent, but for the price you can do much much better in the city. Super Duper has similar prices but significantly better food, and In-N-Out is the undisputed king considering the price.
author: Neel D.

description:
Just made my first visit. Ordered the veggie burger and was disappointed to find it was actually a black bean burger. Usually that's called out of the menu, since it has such a distinct flavor.  The patty was not very firm, and ended up oozing out the sides of the bun. Not at all a satisfying veggie burger experience. It's a bummer, because the bun, grilled onions, etc., were delicious.  But, without a good veggie burger option, I will not return.

Also got the veggie fries (guess they're usually fried in lard), and they were quite good. Wish they had a smaller order, though, because the amount was far too much for one person. 

One other thing to note was how long it took for my order to be completed.  More than 15 minutes. Far too long to wait for a burger and fries. Don't know if it would've been shorter without the veggie fries.
author: Lyn R.

description: Great burgers and fries and great staff, somewhat on the pricy side but it's all organic meat so it's reasonably priced when you consider that. I have eaten at most of the top burger places in SF (fancy and hole in the wall) and this place can challenge or beat any. Don't pass this spot up if your looking for a new burger place.
author: Freddie Q.

description:
(Sam Jackson voice) Mmmm!! This is, a tasty burger.

High quality all around from the meat down to the milkshakes. 

A bit expensive but definitely worth it. 

This place will do well on west p.
author: Greg Poupon M.

description:
Just tried this place out for the first time. Here is why I only gave it 3 stars:
I ordered a 1/3lb Bacon Avocado burger, milk shake and the fries were a separate order.
Burger was cooked to order, but the burger was falling apart while I was eating it, and the bacon was chewy. Although I did like the bun it was on. 
I was not a fan of the "home made ketchup" they had. Tasted like I had smeared marinara sauce all over. (3 over 5 stars)
Fries came out well, but I had to pay for it separately (4 out of 5 stars)
Milk Shake was the savior here, but a little on the high cost side. (4 out of 5 stars)
By my self, ordering what would seem to be a basic meal, it came out to $25 with tax and tip. It was good to try once, but if I had to feed a family of 5, it's not worth it. Just my humble opinion, but there are other better burger joints in the area.
author: Adrian D.

description: I am not one write many reviews , but this place is so good. The milk shakes are delicious, the fries are cooked perfectly, and the burgers are made from the tastiest cows on earth. Well worth it. But don't take my word for it. Go in and check it out. Friendly staff will help you and the hunger you had will melt away in a fantastic eating experience.
author: Amber L.

description: Had an hamburguer for dinner. Quarter pounder medium done filled with lettuce, tomato, caramelized onion, pickles and calibur's sauce and topped it with cheddar cheese by recomendation of the waiters who were really kind. You can serve yourself fresh water and extra sauce too!
author: Eduardo M.

description: This is the best burger place I have found in the Sunset. The meat quality is excellent and I get the gluten free bun and it's way better then the one at other places nearby. The service is personable. The chef hand delivered our order and noticed we hadn't gotten ourselves napkins and he ran and got them for us. They have a good selection and everything is good quality.
author: matthew m.

description:
Sorry, but there is nothing special about their burger. With so many great burger options in the city like Causwells, Roam, Chez, etc., I expected something amazing when i ate here.

I was pretty annoyed that when I ordered, the worker never asked me about adding cheese. Like seriously? If you aren't gonna ask me what cheese I want, then it should be included automatically. There was no clear signage about cheese options. Definitely not visible on the topping list. So I had my burger with no cheese. So that sucked.

Even without the cheese, there was a lack of flavor going on. Beef patty was just okay, seemed a bit on the dry side. And their "Sauce" tastes like a bland salsa. Only real flavors were the caramelized onions and mushrooms.

I got the chili cheese fries, and that wasn't that great either. 

The only bright spot of the dine in, was my vanilla milkshake.

I wouldn't say this burger joint is overpriced. I think if the food is amazing, the price will be justified. So I guess spending $23 and change on a mediocre experience didn't feel that great.

The people here are nice, and I wanted to love this place because I live close by, but don't think I will be back anytime soon.
author: Charles L.

description: I came here with my friends for dinner. It is delicious and cheap. I would suggest the Garlic Fries, one of their burgers, and going there for lunch or dinner. I hope to return here.
author: Will D.

description: Burgers are fresh and made from local ingredients! Fast service, neat place, fries are really tasty and the milkshakes are amazing. Serving is huge! You'll get the most from your money! Totally coming back!
author: Krizzia C.

description:
Delivery came in about 40 minutes. The driver was nice, even though he did not get out of his car and he handed my food through his open passenger window. Some people have a self-locking gate, door, etc and can't just leave the front entry open while running out to the street, so I was glad I had my house keys on me.

French fries were so salty and they were soggy too. I would not have minded it being soggy. But the salt was so overwhelming that I tossed the fries in the compost bin.

Advice to restaurant owner: go lightly on the salt. And also, with hamburger delivery, if someone requests tomato, please have it in a separate container or separate it from the burger. My hamburger bun was soggy and soaked from the tomato slices.

The burger patty itself was good. I dunno, I just don't think I'll try this place again. Delivery fee was $5 and then tip was additional (I confirmed with eat24 that the delivery fee did not include tip) and if the food was good, I would not mind. I'll stick to Super Duper.
author: Wendy L.

description:
This is my first time here, and I was expecting it to be as good as the reviews said. HOWEVER, I am extremely disappointed in their food and service. 

First of all, the cashier was rude and not polite at all. I ordered 2 quarter pounders, one with everything and cheese, and the other one with everything, bacon and avocado, and a side of garlic fries. The buns were too sweet which overpowered the whole burger. The meat was done medium rare like what I had asked for, but it had NO seasoning at all. Overall, the flavors of the burger did not complement each other.  

Secondly, the garlic fries had a bitter taste because of the rosemary garlic mixture. NOTHING GARLICY ABOUT IT AT ALL. And also, it came with their "homemade sauce" which he said was ketchup, but as it turns out, it's just marinara sauce which does not taste good with fries. 

I spent $28 dollars, and it was SO NOT WORTH IT AT ALL. Super overpriced. With this amount of money, I could have bought 4 IN-N-OUT MEALS!! Never going back again.
author: Anna L.

description: I was moved to write this review today after my fifth visit to Calibur. I'm getting totally addicted to this place and nothing would please me more than if everyone could experience what Calibur offers.  Most basic, the burgers are totally amazing, juicy, delicious with an old-fashioned beefy taste that I haven't encountered since my childhood.  I'm serious; these burgers are f'ing extraordinary. If you don't specify otherwise, they'll be cooked medium rare.  The first time I got one of these medium rare burgers I was alarmed, having grown used to gray over cooked patties because of the danger of pathogens in rare ground beef.   But no worries here; their meat is super fresh and local, from a ranch up in Mendocino.  If you're still worried, just specify medium when you order.  A standard burger comes on an almost magical bun, more like brioche than commercial bread.  It's topped with delicious griddled  onions, lettuce, tomato and sauce.  Today I added blue cheese to the burger, and that's the way I'll order it forever.  I wish I could accurately explain how delicious these burgers truly are. In Michelin Guides a restaurant with a star is described as worthy of a detour from a planned route. And so that's how I'll finish this review; Calibur is worth a trip from anywhere in the city - so today I anoint it SF's first Michelin Star burger place. Bravo Calibur!
author: Peter D.

description: This burger place wasn't bad but wasn't as memorable either.  I prefer the bullshead restaurant down the street.  It was nice to try something new from the neighborhood restaurants though.
author: Belle P.

description:
Absolutely delicious burgers cooked to perfection and incredibly juicy. Fries made with beef tallow? Outstanding served with Calibur sauce, a homemade ketchup with fennel.

I had a chance to talk to one of the owners, Sean. He's incredibly passionate about what he does. A former caterer, he had a vision for a burger place where friends and family can enjoy a fresh, simple menu of burgers, fries and shakes. Given the great food and the fact that he seems to have a bunch of regular customers he knows on a first name basis, it looks like he's done a pretty good job accomplishing that vision.
author: Dan C.

description: Hands down one of the best burgers I have enjoyed in a while. I ordered the Organic beef burger, with bacon, avocado and blue cheese. The bacon was nice and crispy, lots of creamy avocado, and the blue cheese was just right. I liked the house made special sauce too. Also, the gluten free bun was surprisingly good. I'd like to know what kind they use. I don't usually come across nice and fluffy gluten free buns. All and all it was a pleasant Door Dash experience with Calibur!
author: Elizabeth W.

description: Found this place out of the blue and was blown away by their amazing burgers and kind hospitality. I did a little extra onions on my burger (which I didn't want at all) but they corrected it within a few minutes and even let me keep the burger instead of tossing it out (my nd will eat anything and was excited he got an extra burger). And people say this place is expensive but when you bit into the juicy burger you'll forget just how much you paid for it. You can clearly taste the high quality meat and ingredients of this burger. And coming from a girl who not only works at a burger joint but craves burgers on the daily, I've been around the block when it comes to which burgers are where it's at or not and I'm happy to say that Calibur will be on my list of regular places to get some great food. Keep going strong guys!!! :)
author: Holli K.

description: The food was fantastic.  The fries are a sin.  The homemade catsup, the bomb. The nice young man working there couldn't have been more helpful and lovely!   I'll so be back.
author: Stephanie N.

description:
3 stars for flavor,  extra 1 star for good quality ingredients.  
I wanted to try this place because of the concept.  I like to support these kinds of establishments.  
Parking was easy,  came around 5pm on a Saturday before the evening rush.  Place was clean.  Customer service was great.  
I order 1/3 pounds burger with everything and cheese for $1 extra.  Husband and I shared their tallow fries and cookies n cream shake.  Burger was really juicy,  veggies were good quality and pickles were good quality also.  They use their own ketchup,  i was a bit disappointed it didn't have mayo and mustard since i prefer mine that way.  I did overhear someone ordering with mayo though. Burger was ok for me though,  it lacked salt and flavor.  I know grassfed beef and what i like about it is that you can taste the beefiness,  if you know what I mean.  
Fries were cooked well.  I was a bit disappointed when I read that they use a mix of tallow and rice bran oil.  I know tallow is expensive that's why a lot of establishments use cheap oil and this place had to use a mix.  But it has its great health benefits and lots of flavor too. I was hoping I found a place that uses good oil when I don't feel like making my own fries.  I was even willing to pay the price.  
I do like the direction they're going and it's a good place worth checking out.
author: Claire J.

description: Been here four times. Cooked to order on the spot with fast service & great folks aim to please with a fair price. Consistently excellent burgers based on quality meat. Perfect fries. Excellent with a good, dark ale. We bring them home living nearby & give the fries an extra shot in the toaster oven adding a bit of malt vinegar. Burgers are crispy on the outside & moist inside. Buns don't get soggy like many places do. I like mine with bacon & sometimes avocado, my wife likes cheese. We've tried burgers worldwide - Calibur's are as good as the best.
author: Terry W.

description:
I've eaten here several times and have never had a negative experience. The co-owner Patrick told me that "he wanted to make a burger he would feel good about serving to his family" and that is exactly what he has created. Almost everything that goes into the burgers are 100% organic, but more over, the burger tastes better than any burger I have had in San Francisco.

The staff are all knowledgeable and personable thanks to the care that the owners put into training. Ask any question about your order and the FOH staff will almost certainly have the answer. While they are pricey ($7+) the portions are also massive and you will never leave here hungry. As a burger enthusiast, I'd recommend Calibur to anyone who considers themselves a fan of burgers/fries/shakes. Will definitely be coming back!
author: Jacob A.

description:
A few weeks ago, the SF Chronicle had a big write-up of Calibur tossing around words like organic, sustainable, grass-fed, etc.  We decided to try it based on their review and were not satisfied.

Located near the West Portal Muni station, parking is rather difficult during the day.  We parked a few blocks away in the residential neighborhood and had a leisurely walk there.  It was lunch time midweek and it wasn't very busy.  We ordered a couple of 1/3# burgers and one strawberry shake ($5.95).  Our food arrived relatively quickly, but the sandwich was too mushy.  Too many soggy ingredients were in the burger.  It really didn't have much flavor, though it was cooked nicely.  The shake was thick, but was also a little flat.

This was an expensive lunch ($20+) for a couple of burgers and one shake.  Sometimes I think restaurants toss out descriptive words about the quality of their so call organic foods to justify the rather stiff prices.  It is not a burger place for a middle income family with modest means.
author: Robert J.

description:
We found this nice little surprise in West Portal and had some great burgers. It really fits that 50s, throwback feel that west portal has (i'm not the only one that thinks that right?) but has a very millennial, organic focus to it. In the vein of old burger joints, It keeps its options pretty limited and focused. You can get a quarter pound burger, a 3rd pound burger and a half pound burger. The patties are all made at the site and that includes the vegetarian burgers. The burgers we had were really good, as were the fries (they make a great housemaid ketchup) and milkshakes. 

They also get bonus points for great music. We will likely be heading back next time I'm in need of a burger fix.
author: Baron C.

description: Great spot!! Came here while visiting family in SF and randomly picked out this place to eat. I must say DELICIOUS!!! I'm from LA and there are plenty of bomb.com burger joints and this place is one of them!!!! I recommend everyone to try this place out!!
author: Samira B.

description:
This is one of the kind rather chain hamburger restaurants like the Roam or Super Dupe burger.  As for the independent one of the kind the price is not that expensive.  But a bit cheaper than these. 
Due to California drought the food cost has all gone up but the owner guy Shaun is nice enough to didn't raise the price.
I think it can be nice price since I've paid 10.00 dollars for the organic ice cream and organic grass fed hamburger. 
It has been five months old for this Calibur and I wish I can taste the its homemade sauce for the burger and fries.  I got fed up with all kind of corn syrup ridden Junki food.  Hopefully this place can be succeed so that be around for ages.
author: Piano B.

description:
Solid burgers, fries, and shakes. The simplisity of the menu is a bonus. I never trust a place with a novel type of menu.
Grass fed, organic, local fa la la!! The burgers are perfect, the bun holds up but not too filling, thick patties from 1/4lb to 1/2lbers
Kind spirited owners,
Support local small businesses!!
author: ERICA E.

description:
I have been a repeat customer of Calibur for a few weeks after having discovered them through an app. They have amazingly good food. The burgers are customizable for even the pickiest eaters and purists. The tallow fries are hands down the best in the City. 
  The amazing food is only to be surpassed by stellar customer service. My most recent order was seen to personally by one of the owners who went above and beyond to make sure my experience was great and that my business is appreciated. I cannot express how impressed I am overall with Calibur and it's amazing staff and owners. Definitely recommend and will be a faithful customer.
author: Tone G.

description:
I love the idea of this place - organic food and simple menu.  The staff was very nice and welcoming.
However, the burger was just ok.  there was supposed to be a "calibur sauce" on it and I didn't taste it.  The burger was bland.  Seasoning or a better sauce would  go a long way here. 
The fries were very good.  5 star fries.
The chili cheese fries were disappointing to me.  There were green peppers in the chili.  I HATE green peppers.  They are not a normal ingredient in chili and this ruined it for me.  The rest of my family liked the chili just fine but I was very disappointed.
Overall, this is a 3 star.  I would not go back for the burgers unless they changed the recipe or the sauce.  I would go back for the plain fries though.
author: Stephanie H.

description:
I wish I had believed Robin A's review and not all the others before we went there. That review totally nailed it. 

It's weird--everything is good except the burger patty itself, but that meat is nasty. 80s amusement park gross. Our stomachs remain in recovery.
author: William S.

description: Delicious every time. I usually have Postmates deliver it and it's consistently good. I'm not a fan of the house made ketchup, but the burgers, shakes and fries are solid.
author: James R.

description: Delicious organic burgers with amazing french fries! They have house made organic ketchup and milkshakes from three twins organic ice cream. A great place to come with the family in the adorable Portola neighborhood!
author: Tigris A.

description:
If you live in the surrounding areas of West Portal (Parkside, Sunset, Ingleside, etc), no need to drive 15 minutes to in and out while having to wait 30 minutes for a damn burger. Super duper in downtown? No thanks, too far. Calibur is the place to go. It's nice to have a burger joint in our area!

They have quality burgers, their paddies are on point(request medium-rare), extra crispy fries are actually crispy and they even make their own ketchup. (It's the small details that count) 

It's not a fine dining restaurant, so don't listen to these people expecting fine dining service. The employees are chill, their menu is simple, and whatever you need is right in front of you. They have ice cold water as well (yes I said ice cold).
author: Richie K.

description: Oh Yea!!!!!! Yummmmmmm-y amazing burgers 3 sizes AND a vegetarian too! The most delicious chili fries - homemade yummy!  The standard caliber style - Carmelites onions, caliber sauce, lettuce, tomatoes and pickles! You can even add a fried egg!! This is definitely a place to visit if you want first class quality ingredients and fabulous burgers and sweet ice cream and milk shakes!!!  You won't regret visiting. Give a little extra time for parking, well worth it!
author: Teresa P.

description:
My husband and I decided to check this place out randomly on our way home from work. It looked like your average "fast-casual" burger place. We ordered quarter pounder burgers, fries and shakes.

The burger was cooked PERFECTLY, the beef literally melted in my mouth. GREAT quality beef and the Calibur sauce is delicious. The shakes were made with Three Twins ice cream, which is great since my husband is allergic to corn syrup and usually can't drink milkshakes. The manager was very friendly and came by our table to check on us. 

Overall we were very happy with our meal but YIKES is it pricey! Two burgers, two fries and two shakes = $38.00! The place looks like your average cheap burger place so we were surprised by the cost. SIX dollars for a milkshake is a little much in my opinion. 

However, the portions were very large and in the end we ended up with WAY too much food. In the future we will probably share an order of fries and a shake. 

We will definitely come back again.
author: E V.

description: Not a cool spot. The burgers here are way over priced for the quality of the burger. The menu is way too small as well. On top of this the condiments are so small I can see why this spot is never busy. When I order a burger a expect a BIG JUICY BURGER not some shrimp sized patty. A change needs to come here so that the cost and quality of the food are equivalent to reach other.
author: Robert F.

description: Service is so slow as to defy belief. 15 minutes and counting for a milkshake with the store half empty. Their logistics are terrible
author: Vijay G.

description: This place is the Bomb.com!!! Great Service, Awesome Food! Even the owner came out to greet us. I mean he really greeted us sincerely!!! If you are looking for an amazing local burger joint, this is the spot!!!
author: Kenneth C.

description:
New burger joint on West Portal with 4.5 stars!? Sounds like a dream come true. When it comes to burgers (and burritos), I consider myself I foodie. I've had hundreds all of the world. So why the bad review? I really hate to do this, but I think this would help management. 

The Good: Fries were unique and I enjoyed them. Organic items on the menu, simplistic menu which I'm a fan of and sugar cane coke bottles. 

The Bad: I ordered a medium rare burger and it came extremely rare. Sadly, I took one bite out of the burger already and swallowed (and got sick shortly after). I never usually send items back, but this time I had too. The meat was so rare, the center was cold. I never order a burger anything other than medium rare (best flavors, imo), so trust me, I know what rare and medium rare looks like. The owner (I believe) agreed and apologized several times. He was really on top of it and I applaud him for handling it so well. He brought me another burger and followed up within 3 minutes. Sadly, this time it was cooked well done, but I didn't want to prolong my dinner since my girlfriend was nearly done with her food. As an FYI, her burger was medium well versus her requested medium. 

FOOD/DRINK: 
-Got the 1/3 pounder with cheddar cheese and avocado
-My girlfriend ordered the 1/4 pounded with cheddar cheese
-Large fries
-Coke and Sprite (bottles)
Total Bill: 32 dollars

AMBIANCE: Simple burger joint decor, not a whole lot of character or personalized. They had the giants game on though, which was nice. 

SERVICE: Unlike my fellow yelpers, the service was very good. One inconvenience is if you order a bottle soda, you need to grab it on your own, then walk back to the cashier to have them remove the cap. Often times, waiting for someone to finish their order. It would better to have a bottle cap opener on that utensils table, since the restaurant is self serve anyways. 

CREDIT CARD: Yes

PARKING:  Meter

OVERALL: No matter how good a burger is, if you don't cook it properly.. it can't be that great. It may be growing pains since they're new, so I hope to try them out sometime again. However, definetely not a good first experience.
author: Austin N.

description:
While walking here we were musing that for a new burger place in sf, they gotta deliver!!! 
We went over what we had to compare it to...umami, roam, in n out, super duper....
Well they got a great foothold here in our book! Big juicy burgers with everything on them (plus caramelized onions included!), house ketchup, crunchy fries... simple menu but what more do you need, really? Next time we are trying the shakes!
author: Kitty O.

description: I've been waiting for this place to open and finally went in and had a burger. The menu is simple, which is nice. Decor is cool. Very clean establishment. Burger? Hands down the BEST burger in sf. Meat is super high quality. Cheese is perfect. I love me a good bun. Condiments all fresh. Do yourself a favor and go there ASAP!
author: Mary V.

description:
Here's my dish on this new West Portal burger spot.

The good:
I was a big fan of Joe's Cable Car. Calibur does a better burger, a MUCH better burger. The meat is excellent. The veg. with the burger is fresh and tasty. Great bun. The ketchup onion sauce absolutely rocks the burger. Flavorful and perfectly cooked. Hands down the best burger I've had in San Francisco, and I've been to all the supposed top spots. The fries are also very good, as are the shakes.

The bad:
It's a small place. However, so far seating hasn't been that bad. 

A few comments:
- Calibur had kind of a rough start. I was there early on and service was slow + they were having problems with their fries. However, both problems have been more than fixed. The service is now very good and the fries are now excellent.
- Their homemade ketchup sauce rocks on their burgers, but I like regular ol' ketchup on my fries... which they have if you ask for it.
- Wish they'd put a condiment station by their water: ketchup(s), mustard, & hot sauce(s)
- Wish they'd add onion rings to the menu.

Summary:
Calibur is now my favorite spot for a burger in San Francisco.
author: Michael S.

description:
Wow, amazing burgers. We ordered 1/4 pounder and 1/3 pounder, both "Calibur-style" and both with egg on top. They had Siracha and Tapatio to add, if you wanted - which completely made my day. 

Hamburgers were super juicy and super delicious. Split one order of fries, and alternated dipping our fries between homemade ketchup and the amazing juice that dripped off from my burger. Topped off with Vanilla and Strawberry milkshakes. Whew. :-)

First time here and plotting next trip back.
author: Theresa B.

description: Something has CHANGED here!  We ordered what we always get but somehow it just didn't taste as good as it did in the past.  This was our go-to place for burgers but we may have to keep searching.  Also, they charged 75 cents for ranch dressing to go with our fries.  That's not right.....!
author: Donna R.

description: Damn good burgers...delivered?  My dream has come true.  If only they would put the lettuce on the side, it is soggy by the time it arrives.  Fries are awesome too.
author: brett b.

description: Calibur has the best burgers in west portal and some of the best is SF.  They had some growing pains the first but have significantly improved since.   I have upgraded  my review score.
author: Jeff G.

description: Good food, but very slow service. After 30+ minutes waiting for very simple food we received no apology for the wait. Meat was not cooked as ordered. They ran out of fries... Not coming back...
author: Matthew W.

description: My bacon dbl cheese burger was juicy and cooked to perfection. Surrounding it the was a moist buttery brioshe bun, the best I've ever tasted!The staff was super nice and i felt at home. Safe to say I will be a regular here.
author: matthew w.

description: Pretty good burger shop. The veggie burger will KILL you with spiciness.  Fries are awesome as is the bread on the veggie burger and the grilled cheese. Nice salads, too.  Great local part of San Francisco.
author: Amy V.

description:
Got the quarter pounder with 3 toppings: bacon, mushrooms, and egg.
I have to wonder if the topping proportions are randomly sized or they just try to fit it all in. I did here this couple nearby compare bacon portions, and they seemed different.

Burger was okay, got it medium-well, the juices pretty much could not contain themselves and made a mess. I was really surprised about how intact my egg remained. The bacon wasn't crispy, it was thick though, just not well crisped. Mushrooms were tasty though. Bun was what I expected, nice partially-shiny crown, something that will hold all the yummy...it did give out when I got more than half-way done, got all soggy on me :(

Also got fries to share. Really should have known better, for two people, a large order of fries is overkill and just an accessory to this meal I could have gone without. A bit on the limpy side too. Their house-made ketchup isn't bad, it's different, but you have to see it in the unprocessed light vs the standard ketchup they also offer. It's weird, and I haven't decided if I like it, but I don't hate it.

Milkshake was really light. Flavorful, yum, yes, but if you want thick (and cold) this won't be it. If you don't want to fight your drink, then get this $6 shake, or grab a squirt soda, OR Mexican coca cola it!

It's still 4 stars because there is potential, and really for what they are offering, the price is on the mark. Can't really say what the "special" factor is. Maybe it's offering high-quality ingredient for your basic burger and accessories? I like to think of this as my fancier In-N-Out. Yes...that's why we shelled nearly $40 here for 2 burgers, a milkshake, and fries.

And they really weren't as slow as some of the reviews made this place seem. It felt like an average wait time of 5-10 minutes for orders, and place was getting packed after we got there.

So food is solid 3.5 (noting botched, nothing really profound)
I want them to do well...and amaze me next time, so I rounded up okay!
author: Carol L.

description:
New Burger place on West Portal, FINALLY!  

This burger has great flavor, awesome bun and the burger to bun ratio is on point.  Very nice, thanks guys well needed in the area.
author: Patrick T.

description: Was looking for a good burger place that served gf buns, an me and my two friends came here and that was such a good call. I got so many toppings and Sebastian helped me out the entire way through. So many mods on my burger and not one mistake, nice job kitchen. Food was on point, and Sebastian kept checking up on us through out the meal cuz he knew we were a high maintenance group. Seriously, that guys is a restaurant natural. Spot is lucky to have him.
author: Lazer W.

description:
We love this cute little burger place and are so happy that it popped up in west portal!  

We visit caliber almost weekly as my son loves their burgers and the serving is just perfect for him and so yummy and juicy!  He literally knocks on the door in the mornings when we walk by because if he could, he'd want breakfast, lunch and dinner from here!

Great addition to the neighborhood!
author: Kristi B.

description:
This place uses high quality ingredients and you can tell through the taste. The beef tastes really good, the vegetables taste fresh, and the fries are tasty.

Of course, using good ingredients comes at a little bit of a higher price, but I certainly don't mind for anything that is of quality.

The fries are really good. They have a nice texture to them. Mildly crispy on the outside but still a little soft. I found them to be seasoned really well.

A couple things that I wished they did, as far as my personal preferences go. I'm a huge mayo fan, and I think that any really tasty burger will either have mayo or a mayo based sauce (like In-N-Out spread, Big Mac Special Sauce, Shack Sauce) to take it to another level. Here I think they only add their house made ketchup (which personally I don't care too much for, and thankfully isn't a dominating flavor).

Also, I'm more of a soft bun kind of guy. While you can take a look at their bun and immediately tell that they are fresh and artisanal, they aren't as soft as I like. I like burgers with soft buns because they kind of stick closer to the patty and holding the ingredients much better. Eating the burger here can be a little more cumbersome, and I think that's because of the bun.

Despite my nitpicking, they still make a really good burger. Perhaps one of the best in the neighborhood and surrounding area. The service is friendly and attentive which certainly goes a long way in making me want to come back.

Another bonus is they serve Three Twins ice cream. Haven't had an opportunity to order it here, but would definitely come back to try a shake some day.
author: Jeffrey J.

description: My husband and I came here for a pre-movie bite. It's a very clean, bright casual place. We weren't super hungry so we decided to split a burger. We ordered a bacon cheeseburger, it was cooked really well and as a nice service they cut the burger in half for us and put it on two plates without us even asking. The fries we good, but we weren't partial to their homemade ketchup. The only downside is the prices, a little more costly than other casual places in West Portal, but I would come here again for the food and really good customer service.
author: Lisa B.

description: Burger great. Chili-cheese fries perfect. Shake flavorful. Portions generous. Everything about the burger was just the right density and substance, if you know what I mean. Often, large burgers will have too tough a bun which squishes the ingredients between out the sides, or have a bun or patty that's too loose and falls apart under pressure, but this burger was just right. As the trays warn, it is very juicy and leaks a lot.
author: Jeremy C.

description:
High competence
.
Perhaps not in spelling: http://dictionary.reference.com/browse/caliber

But absolutely in burgers. Homemade veggie burger was a huge black bean infused patty of brilliance. Comes topped with caramelized onions, lettuce tomato and pickles.

Each bite was outstanding especially when paired with Calibur sauce. Loved it was ketchup based instead of mayo.

Also loved learning ketchup will make the bun soggy so it's served on the side. For $9 the burger isn't cheap all the toppings are included plus insightful knowledge for free.

Menu is limited and the space is sparse with nice vintage touches. They clearly invested where it counts as both the food and staff were of impressive quality.

High praise all around.

(including to Erica W. http://www.yelp.com/user_details?userid=GNDPGumn6Gy7c9a9xTk_mg who pointed out the name isa combination of CALIifornia and BURger - thanks!)
author: Jason B.

description: I eat here pretty much only for their fries. I get them extra crispy and they are incredible. Love that they are fried in tallow!
author: Jason C.

description:
I'm sorry, but I simply don't understand what people like so much about this place. The ambiance is nice and the well dressed up hole in the wall is inviting and in a good area with lots to see, but other than that there isn't much else that shines for me. The biggest problem is the price, and boy for what you get it is high. A burger can run you anywhere from 8 bucks all the way to around 15 dollars. Toppings are WAY to expensive. $1.50 for your average slice of cheddar is pretty steep. Milkshakes cost almost as much as the cheapest burger and the veggie burger is your typical run of the mill patty. I get that this place is supposed to be organic and GMO-free but honestly it doesn't even taste that way. This reminds me of a more expensive, lower quality super duper burger. At least at super duper burger you can tell the food is high quality. 

The people who work there are nice enough and they are willing to answer any questions that you may have, as well as bus your table for you (which was unexpected at this kind of place) but strangely enough one of the people working there (seemed like a manager type) was watching my company and I eat maintaining eye contact with me and then the second I finish eating he almost jogged over to the table to grab my dishes. Maybe it was a one time thing but the high price alone would make me not want to come back.
author: Nathan J.

description: Great service! Very nice staff :D the best burger I have ever had! The meat is juicy and everything is fresh. Spacious inside and clean. It may be expensive but it is definitely something you might wanna try ;) although I asked for medium rare and my patty was well done, it was still delicious. No worries, practice makes perfect :)!
author: Karen J.

description:
15.01.06      First Visit

Food --------------------- 4
Service  ----------------- 4 - 4 1/2
Cleaniness ------------- Very good

Hamburger
   Buns from SF's Panorama Bakery Co.
   Panaroma Beef
   Grinds Panorama organic grass-fed beef every day.

Twice Fried Fries
   in house-rendered beef talon
   organic potatoes 

Three Twins ice cream
In West Portal for roughly 2-3 month.

In an article ... co-owner Sean Patrick quoted:   
   "The menu's not 100 percent organic. 
    But for sure, all the time, without fail, 
           the meat, mushrooms and lettuce are," 

They "kick up a notch" on everything
   Bread
   Beef
   Fries (twice fried and talon)
   3 Twins ice cream
   Their homemade ketcup (have to ask them)
author: S.K. Y.

description: This place has great burgers and awesome fries - very crispy. I love the house ketchup. The staff is very friendly and there were lots of smiles everywhere. I ate the double cheeseburger with a fried egg. OMG!!! Loved it. The yolk oozed out and all over the  geese and patties. So tasty.
author: Wilfred B.

description: I had the quarter pounder. It was pretty small and was about $8, if I remember right. Go to In and Out instead..it's just as good.
author: Karissa S.

description:
We have been going to Calibur almost weekly for about six months now.  When we get takeout we only get the burgers.  The four of us have different toppings and they are all top notch.  The avocado always amazes me because it is the perfect ripeness every single time.  The best topping though is the caramelized onions and I think that is what really what pushes this burger to be my favorite.  The bun is the absolute best I've ever had. The burger itself is so juicy and has such a wonderful flavor.  
When we eat there, we also get a shake and some drinks.  The variety of drinks is fantastic and the milkshakes are how I remember from when I was a kid.  
The staff is super friendly and they are really nice to the kids.  I hope that Calibur will be on West Portal for many years to come.
author: Christie S.

description: So 19 dollars for a burger, Coke and fries is super pricey, tasty but the burger was somewhat bland. Nice staff. The biggest appetite  killer is the rampant children running and screaming in the doorway and a young father was changing a baby's diapers on the chair at an adjacent table.
author: Mark N.

description:
Very cozy location.
Egg on top of my burger cooked perfect
the special sauce taste like sweet marinara sauce.
bacon was ok
milk shake was awesome
chili fries ok
author: Justin I.

description: Food is good. Service, not so much. Called in a to-go order and the guy who took our order said 15 mins. We got there in 10 and the guy working the register was nice and said it'd probably be 5 more minutes. Perfect. After waiting 20 minutes and seeing others who came in while we were waiting get their food, the guy finally realized that one of the bags that had been sitting there when we walked in was ours. I complained that now the whole order would be cold and he tried to convince me that it had just been brought out. And then he got angry with us for wanting to check it. A simple "sorry" would have fixed it. But the rude treatment we got instead insures we won't be back.
author: deb b.

description:
I don't know why I hadn't tried this place sooner - maybe because I typically have burgers for lunch, and am usually not in the area at lunch time. We decided to have burgers for dinner, and the manager made me feel welcome right away, explaining the menu, etc. 

I ordered the third pound burgers, forgoing the fries because third pound burgers sounded like enough, right? But as I was waiting for my order I watched the family at the next table enjoying their burgers and fries, and those fries looked really good. The manager must be psychic, because he came over and said he wanted to be sure he got my order right: "You didn't want the fries, correct?" I had to admit that that they looked pretty tempting...he said he would include a half order gratis, so we could try them. Sweet!

When we got home, we found what looked like a whole order of fries included, and they tasted every bit as good as they looked. The burgers were also excellent: juicy and flavorful, everything you could want in a burger for a very reasonable price. We will definitely be back!
author: Meredith S.

description:
3.5 Stars.  Solid burger, decent fries, weak shake.

The burger needs little, if any, help.  It can hold it's own against most challengers.  Wonderful patty, good bun.  The bacon I ordered was a little undercooked, but was of good enough quality that I didn't care.

The fries were the soggiest tallow fries I've ever had (they were delivered, but still).  Other than the sog factor, the fries were good and I would have eaten them all if the burger hadn't filled me up.

The shake, though.  Not that good.  It had a skim milk quality to it.  Maybe I've been spoiled by Popson's and their half n' half shakes, but this one seemed really bland.  

Overall, a good burger joint with plenty to offer for reasonable prices.
author: Lester B.

description: I like burgers. I really like Calibur burgers. Their fries are fried in cow tallow... I dunno wtf cow tallow is but it makes fries taste amazing... And their organic catsup.... GTFO here... A lot of places make a burger with an amazing patty, but the bun doesn't hold up.... Not here... The bun is solid. And now you can get Calibur delivered??? Wtf. I'm not sure if Obama had anything to do with this, but thank you Obama, America is a great place.
author: Eucalyptus J.

description: Very bland burger. Fries were good but there are many burgers that are way better. Don't really understand why this place gets 4 stars. Kind of overpriced and nothing special
author: Jeremy R.

description: Pretty solid veggie burger. They offer gluten free buns and lettuce wraps but that's not very clear on the menus. Feels a little like in and out burger which I see as not a plus.
author: jonni s.

description: Perfect neighborhood spot for a classic burger and fries. The meat is organic and tastes great. I love coming here. The restaurant is unpretentious and makes a few items really, really well. Highly recommended!
author: Kenneth S. L.

description: Spent almost $20 for a quarter pound burger with avocado, cheddar, and mushrooms with a side of garlic fries. Good, but not a good value for the money. Super Duper is still my favorite burger in the City.
author: Maximillian M.

description:
I was really looking forward to this place after reading the reviews. The employees and the owner there are really nice and accommodating. That's why I gave them three stars. 

The burger was a little disappointing though. It was under-seasoned and dry. The burger lacked flavor and a good crust. It was far too lean for my liking. But the egg was cooked perfectly- brown and crispy whites and a runny yolk. The drippings made a nice sauce for my fries. More so than the homemade ketchup. 

I like the idea of fries cooked in beef fat. But I gotta be honest, I've had better fries. People want organic and grass-fed beef, but it's still gotta be tasty. Go to NY and taste a Shake Shack burger. That's what a burger should taste like.
author: William B.

description:
5 big 'ole stars for the service, seriously. No restaurant snobs here. 

However, I'm not a big fan of their burgers. I really, really wanted to be, but no. Their "special sauce", my friend and I agreed, isn't that good at all. And the beef itself wasn't even that great, especially considering the price. It's not terrible, but it's definitely 3 stars. I liked the fries, but c'mon, one can't judge a burger place for the fries.

Side note: my husband dropped his Coke bottle on the floor leaving shattered glass everywhere. They were super cool about it and the manager cleaned it up. Thought that was nice. So thanks guys!

Unfortunately, I have to say, head up the block to Bull's Head. They will hook you up with the best burgers in town. Order the mini corn dogs or chili cheese fries for appetizer...you won't regret it.
author: Shannon O.

description: Just ordered through uber eats. Food is incredible as always. Big shout out to Michelle for helping us with the onion situation. Thanks boo!
author: Gregory W.

description: If I can give no stars, thats what I'd want to rate this little place. The only thing bad about this place is the cashier. He was so rude! I was trying to help him out during payment, but he just cut me off as if I was taking up his time.  There was NOBODY in the restaurant other than me and this one other lady.  The food is good but sadly if that's how the customer service is, I can find burgers and chili cheese fries somewhere else.
author: Diane M.

description: Amazing burgers great service! Fries are super good! Nice fresh ingredients and you can really taste the quality! If your in SF it's worth the trip over to calibur for an out of this world burger!
author: Carlos C.

description:
I was happy to see that an organic burger joint was popping up in my neighborhood, but I was very disappointed by the outcome. First and foremost, before a "hello" at the counter, the employee said "We're out of fries." Well, good evening to you too... For just two burgers with no fries and no sodas or milkshakes, the total came to ~$25 dollars. Then we had to wait for over half an hour! They were serving others who had ordered after us! I noticed that two ladies near us complained to an employee because their meat was undercooked and I was worried about how our burgers would turn out. And after 40 minutes of waiting, we received our burgers and my well done burger was pink!! I ate it anyway because I'm not a diva, but that isn't right for an establishment to ever do this, especially if they take pride in individualizing every order and being whole-heartedly organic.

You are better off not coming to this restaurant.
author: Louise C.

description: The burger tasted like paper mache. Lacked any hint of flavor and came out suspiciously fast for one that thick (yet at best lukewarm). The fries were pretty decent.
author: G A.

description: Their veggie burger seems to be made with mostly onion. And it costs over $9. That's without a side of fries or anything. I will never come back here. Good thing the bun was good because that was all I ate, the veggie burger was that bad.
author: Suzanne H.
