description: My half pound burger and garlic fries were cooked to perfection. So delicious! Vanilla milkshake was great as well. Good to know that this place uses all organic ingredients. Will definitely come back for sure!
author: Dianne Jay S.

description: Yay! A burger spot in the neighborhood! Organic Grass Fed California beef, and homemade veggie burgers (soy free!) everything was spot on here including the customer service. Really really great spot. Amazing food, not pretentious and affordable. THANK YOU for what you're doing! Will be back!
author: Lana B.

description: One of the best burgers I've ever had. Also, the fries are 100% perfect. Fast service, friendly waiters and cooks, and amazing food. Give it a shot, you won't regret it.
author: Jules A.

description:
HUUUGE burgers. Juicy. Taste is average.
a weee bit on the salty side
an order of fries is enough to share between 2 people. Fries are good
Three twins ice cream!
Salted caramel milkshake!!! with Clover organic milk!!!
Thrilled there is a cute burger joint in the area if I ever need a fix.
author: Bianca Y.

description: First-timers at Calibur today... brought my kids and some friends along to share the experience. The atmosphere was nice, customer service was great, and burgers were delicious. My oldest son said he "demolished the burger" while my youngest boy described the cookies and cream milkshake as "happiness"! We definitely enjoyed our meal and will visit again thanks to the warm and friendly owners, thank you guys! :))
author: Lisa D.

description: I can't say enough good things about this place. Upon our second visit my wife and I were approached by one of the owners to ask who our meal was. We spoke with him briefly about the company and their mission statement. It was a very welcomed conversation and it mean't a lot to us that there was such a level of professionalism. Ok, we're headed out to Cailbur!!!
author: Daren M.

description: We got a cheeseburger with everything on it but the need patty was not the size of the bun. I probably ate like two inches of just bun nothing else in it. On top of that the lady at the cash register was not very friendly or helpful when we were ordering, and rolled her eyes at me multiple times when I was ordering and paying.
author: Tailor F.

description: Really nice people working here, so that's an A-plus!  The burger was just ok, in my opinion - It was missing something that I just can't point my taste buds on.  We both had the quarter pounder with cheddar and bacon (!) and split a milk shake (with my partner in crime) and the bill came out to be a little around $35. We both appreciated that they serve grass fed and organic beef, so I guess I can justify the price based on that - but sadly the taste was just not there for us to want to come back.
author: Grace K.

description: Very glad to have another affordable place to have grass-fed, organic burgers in town.  Many cheese choices (liked the bleu), and the fries were plentiful  and tasty.  Liked that there was a flat screen TV for watching the NBA conference finals, and the staff was friendly and helpful.
author: G M.

description: This is the worst burger place, dont go, on Friday night, i order just one burger and one fries, i had to wait for 1 hour, whereas people who order after me get their burger, the service is bad, and the burger itself is burn, organic but not grass fed
author: jane s.

description:
$18.38 for 1 good-sized quarter pounder (with three add-on's for $4) and 1 strawberry milkshake is steep, especially for the location that it's in.  I mean, West Portal is a beautiful neighborhood with a combination of chain (Starbucks, Peets, Squat & Gobble, etc.) and local, independent shops (Bookshop West Portal, Two Cats Comics, Ambassador Toys, Shaw's, Goat Hill, Spiazzo, Submarine Center, etc.), but Calibur needs to lower their price.

I placed my order over the phone and the guy (Sean?) was very helpful; I was thinking about the 1/3 pounder, but seeing as I wasn't ridiculously hungry, I went for the 1/4 pounder, no onions and pickles, and adding on mushrooms, egg, and bacon.  I then thought about getting a side of fries, but when the guy over the phone told me the fries was a larger portion, I decided to hold off until next time.  Upon arriving to pick up my order, I found out that if you live or work in or around West Portal, you actually get a small discount off your meal; simply mention it (and perhaps show ID) to a staff prior to paying.  

Alright, so after getting home and taking my burger out of the bag, prior to enjoyment I noticed there were pickles as I clearly instructed, over the phone, "No pickles".  Oh, and I do believe the guy mentioned the burger includes housemade ketchup, which clearly I received zero of.  I should've called to let them know, but didn't want to create any hassle since the guy seemed pretty nice.  Regardless of the errors, the burger was still enjoyable nonetheless; I did appreciate the different add-on's from your typical burger joint.  The runny egg makes for a messier burger, but that's what you get.  For a meal close to $20, I feel the patties could've been thicker (that is, if Calibur shapes their own patties) so customers are getting more of what they paid for. Then again, beef does shrink once they begin cooking on the grill so perhaps shape them larger prior to cooking.  And since people are paying a steep price, I'd suggest creating a more "premium" or original burger that already includes the various sides, perhaps Calibur's original variation on a mushroom burger or burger loco moco.
author: Jessica S.

description: Best burger in San Francisco. One of the only restaurants that understands the lettuce wrap concept, and executes exceptionally. I always eagerly anticipate a good Calibur meal.
author: Ali G.

description: Great service - attentive, friendly and efficient. Burger and fries were good. The place is clean and well lit.
author: Carmencita S.

description:
The 1/3 lb. burger was cooked as ordered (medium), and their homemade sauce (ketchup) was very good with a little kick, plus generous bacon and skimpy cheese. 

The tallow fries didn't meet my expectations though the portion could serve 2-4 people. Before McDonald's switched from beef tallow to vegetable oil for their excellent fries in 1990, it was the perfect recipe. Calibur's tallow was overwhelming. If there's a next time, I'll ask for the vegetarian fries. For the price and taste I'd go elsewhere.

Nearby Hall of Flame in Parkmerced and Blaze at Stonestown offer more satisfaction for premium burgers and fries. Hall of Flame is the better deal with delicious burgers and mediocre fries. Blaze has the edge on french fries, but be prepared for the burger's high ticket price.
author: Kevin C.

description: Great juicy burger.  Simple menu with a perfect focus on making the highest quality organic burger.  I highly recommend Calibur, and so does my 10 year old  :)
author: Charles T.

description: Excellent burgers, tasty tasty fries (mmmmmm), friendly service and the owners are front and center in insuring satisfaction in both service and food. Definitely moving into my heavy rotation list of burger joints. We've been waiting for a true burger joint in West Portal.
author: S C.

description: Good burger with pricey options to add. Fries ok...not noteworthy. Location clean and servers attentive. Overall a bit over average probably a 3.5.....but made it to 4 simply because store notably clean and it was late in day. :-)
author: Sharine d.

description: This place = not worth it. I can think of 7+ burger places way better. Super Duper kills this place & is half the price. The meat was not seasoned at all. The bun was weak. I asked for Medium it was more well done. 2 stars because the food came out really quickly, & the fries were piping hot. Milkshake was good. But overall the burgers are poor. Skip this place.
author: Aaron L.

description: QUALITY THAT SHINES! My new favorite burger place! Calibur does all the little things really well. Twice cooked french fries = a crispy exterior & a creamy potato.  House ground, grass fed, beef and carmelized onions on an awesome bun was juicy and hot.  AS I was half way through the burger I was already planning my next visit.  Good quality & attention to details means a very good burger you can feel good about.  Now I need to bring my family to turn them on to Calibur!
author: Fernando T.

description: I wasn't sure what to expect from the short menu and big line but man the burger was better than any place I've been in SF. I'd give it 5 stars for flavor but knocked it down one for the wait. worth it but I wished it was a tad bit faster. to be fair the they did say it would be 25 minutes for my order but man I was hungry and the food totally hit the spot. next time I come I'll make sure it's not busy.
author: G P.

description: An amazing new spot in West Portal.  The owners are super nice and accommodating.  Oh and did I mention the burger is delicious too!  Usually I prefer regular ketchup, but their special dipping sauce is great.  A very simple menu is all you need when the product is great.  There is probably be a secret menu too.  I am looking forward to eating there often.
author: Jeffrey P.

description: Service is great ! They were all quick run help us in the ordering process . All organic and home made . The burgers here great quality meat ! Didn't feel heavy and tired like you would after most burgers . The homemade ketchup tasted a little like cocktail sauce and made my bun a little soggy . I would recommend all sauces and Carmelized onions on the side of you don't like soggy bread .  Great place for the kids and service was quick and easy
author: S R.

description: Burgers up to a half pound cooked to order! You want rare? Got it! Well done? Done! Want an egg on that? Got it! Catsup made in house too ... Got to check it out! Local business and local owners .... Support!
author: Richard G.

description: Id say 3.5. Food is awesome, but I always have a hard time paying $15 for a burger and fries. If the prices weren't so high, I would be a regular! Worth checking out as its the newest spot in West Portal. Warning they close at 6pm. So if you are craving a burger for dinner after work, Bullshead is the way to go!
author: Ryan B.

description: Service was great, but not impressed with the burgers. The meat was on the tough side for a gourmet burger joint. Maybe will give it another try.
author: Giovani T.

description:
what i ordered... third pounder cheeseburger and fries

bun tasted and textured like an oversized dinner roll, meat was ok... freshly cooked well done even though i told them otherwise, machine formed and gamy in taste maybe because it was really a grassfeed  beef.

fries... well done and hard

ambiance... so-so (souped-up hole in a wall)
service... so-so (a bit cocky high schooler who think he's made it into a prominent cashier job)
cost... $+ (a bit expensive)
author: Gors P.

description: Good veggie burger. Nice service. Casual.
author: jessica d.

description: There is nothing negative to say about this place. The hamburgers and fries are simply delicious and their milkshakes are simply unmatched. Their service is quick and the people that work there are very cool. Love this restaurant!
author: Mike M.

description:
4/5 stars mainly due to its burger with fries and higher price. 

PROS:
-they said everything (like grass fed beef, bread, tomatoes, lettuce, pickles, etc...) is organic except the outside condiments. A burger joint that serves ALL ORGANIC(NO pesticides & GMO) is VERY HARD TO FIND. This can be my go to place since its organic with no GENETIC MODIFICATION of the food that I am eating so I praise them for that. 
-nice staff since it wasnt busy at 5:30 sunday. 
-1/2 lb burger even with no toppings was very juicy!
-tallow fries was fried twice in beef fat(not healthy) but does have beef flavor. To be honest I RATHER EAT BEEF FAT FRIED FRIES OVER FRIES THAT WAS FRIED IN GMO COTTON SEED/CORN OIL ANY DAY! 
And it is true that GMO in general can cause health related issues like unusual reactions from your body after consumption of some GMO foods since your body is not use to the food being genetically created in a lab by altering its genes. Also there is no significant long term studies done about eating GMO foods. But scientists speculate that GMO's might cause DOWNSYNDROME AND INCREASED ASTHMA. Also the government gives permission to the corporations/companies the task of researching and handling GMO's safety if you didnt know. Also if u can please support GMO labeling initiatives of your groceries in FUTURE VOTING BALLETS if you care about what u eat since voting is the least u can do. 

CONS:
-The website does not state clearly that ALL their ingredients are ORGANIC. 
-The burger joint was clean and well lit. But the area where u order is narrow and have to move out the way for food to be brought out. 
-a little pricy. 
-needs more of their calibur sauce in burger. But i was asked if i needed more while eating.   

Being very generous i give it overall 4/5 stars based on food and price. Would give 4.5 if the toppings were cheaper and the fries a larger portion.
author: Organic T.

description: Ordered a burger with avo, blue cheese, onion, etc... it was horrible the bun was so hard and the taste of their organic ketchup is so gross. I did not eat it. Do yourself a favor and do not order the "natural ketchup". I also ordered the kid's grilled cheese, it was edible. Will not be going back.
author: Circuit D.

description: Very good burger a little undercooked but they all undercook them a little..The price is a little high even for a "gourmet" burger. A good place to go once to try it. The Bulls Head is still the best burger in town or at least West Portal!!
author: Keith K.

description: great shakes burgers fries and chili fries just awesome!
author: Jan L.

description: Simple, organic menu done right. Excellent burger cooked the way I asked, the caramelized onion really tops it off.
author: Max F.

description:
I stumbled upon this place while strolling around west portal today. I was hungry but not quite sure what I wanted. I got the aroma from the kitchen walking past and The 1/2 lb burger was the right choice! It was delicious, cooked to order, a perfect medium rare, just the way I like it. Thank you guys, I'll be back, and I'll bring my friends :)
Great addition to the neighborhood
author: Shane D.

description:
Just as I noticed I forgot to eat lunch, I've opened Postmates and looked for a quick burger I can grab. 

This was beyond my expectation it arrived very fast, it was properly wrapped,  seeing the brioche bun immediately made me joyfully smile :)

The burger itself which I usually order medium ( for some obscure reason I stayed with the default option and ordered medium well) but even when it's medium well the burger itself is tender soft and flavorful. 
The fries were nice and crispy . I devoured the whole thing pleasingly. 

Extra points (and tips) to the delivery dude that came to my front door.
author: Mar N.

description: Fresh, Juicy burgers, darn good fries and shakes made from Three Twins ice cream - When it comes to burgers, it doesn't get any better than than this!
author: Richie R.

description: solid burger and fries, i'm never eating fast food ever again. good customer service
author: Livia K.

description: It was good! The food tasted natural, like it's supposed to. Really enjoyed their homemade chili.
author: Violeta L.

description: First of all let's talk about the service... The owner was behind the counter work in the line and in the back like a real member of the team. I personally love to see that when everybody works together the experience is just so much better and you can tell that a place is going to give you amazing food when there's a real team atmosphere and everybody's working together. Now let's talk about the life alteringly outstanding crazy good burgers...... The meat was seasoned well cooked to the perfect temperature I requested all of the veggies toppings were really fresh the bun was toasted perfectly my french fries were amazing and not greasy perfectly seasoned!!! And best of all the food came promptly and at the perfect temperature to eat right then... Or after I finish current round of bingo bash on my phone lol !! All around not only would I recommend this restaurant I would say its a must try if you like good food , a great atmosphere and decor and a kick ass staff this is a place for you if you prefer bland cold food with rude service you definitely shouldn't go here!!
author: Shannon E.

description: The wife and I ate here Saturday.  Burger and fries were awesome, service was great and the place was super clean.  Definitely going back again!
author: steve s.

description: Most delicious burger I've had in a long time. Fresh ingredients and you feel really good afterwards. Don't know why this place is empty all of the time, it has all of the elements of a great burger chain. Organic ingredients! Mexican coke! Prices a little high but you're paying for quality!
author: Mairin H.

description: I've never felt so good after eating a burger.  The burgers here are organic which is awesome-It's so nice to fulfill a burger craving without all the guilt!  Ordering on Eat24 is super easy as you have many choices for toppings and extras.  This was our lucky "winning meal" twice now for the Warriors playoffs including the BIG Championship win last night!!!!!  Go Dubs!  Ordering for pick up went without a hitch on both occasions which really says a lot when placing a large order for 10-15 burgers with different meat temps, and various condiments & toppings.  I spoke to Sean over the phone the 1st time I placed our groups large order because I had forgotten to order a chocolate milkshake, plus I admit I was slightly worried as to how well they would execute the order!  After adding the milkshake and speaking to Sean briefly I learned they were new to using Eat24.  He was very genuine, friendly, and assured me that my order was received and would be ready for pick up in 30 min as I requested...and it was!  Not only that, each burger was neatly labeled on their containers in detail with a sharpie making it really easy for us, and my medium rare burger was a perfect med rare.  Score!  Bun to patty ratio was proportional.  Additionally you can just taste the freshness of the ingredients: the crisp of raw onions and lettuce, a juicy tomato, melted cheddar cheese with a bite, and a soft fresh bun with a spread of Dijon mustard and ketchup -can't get any better than that in my book!  Tallow and Veg fries tasted great, and probably excellent when it's served hot/ non take-out.  The only thing our group was not a fan of is the organic ketchup, mainly because it just does not taste like ketchup, doesn't particularly look like ketchup either consistency wise, besides being red (looks more like puréed organic tomatoes).  But they have regular Heinz ketchup too, so it's a non issue.  Highly recommended and will be back for sure!
author: Caryn H.

description: Local, organic ingredients. Almost everything! A perfectly cooked, grassfed burger. A thick, frosty milkshake, and TALLOW twice fried fries. Did I mention the delicious house-made ketchup? I love this place. My partner loves it. My preschooler loves it. We love to take family and friends here to treat them. I would eat here every day, nay, MEAL! if it didn't have health repercussions, and drain the bank so fast!
author: J R.

description: Anyone who likes a really good burger has to try this place. Awesome fries with organic meat burgers. Great place -super clean, good atmosphere with friendly staff. I would recommend this place wholeheartedly!!!
author: Eileen M.

description: Extremely attentive staff, delicious hamburger! Definitely coming back! :) The place is clean and has a nice background music.
author: Clarissa C.

description: Burger tasty and made correctly to order. So many times I order a medium burger and it comes out well done. This was perfect. The garlic fries were hot and tasty, but too salty and toward the end the rosemary also became overpowering. Overall good burgers. Not totally sure this will be my go-to joint though.
author: Pennan B.

description: Great burger. Great fries. This burger rivals the awesome burger from Super Duper. It's juicy, tasty, and has that great beefy taste I remember as a child.
author: Joe B.

description: Good service, the person who took my order was very personable. Talked with me and was helpful when ordering. Burger was okay, not the best but still a good option if you're at west portal.
author: David D.

description: The juiciest most delicious patty I have ever eaten. That it's all organic, fresh, and hand-prepared, makes the price completely worth it. The owners and staff are sweet as can be. The place is spotless - very important to me. I'll be back - often.
author: Marsha G.

description: Solid burger  even the picky eater ate it. Welcome to the neighborhood. Will see u again.
author: E. C.

description: Sooooooo good. The burger had really good flavor, steak like or something. The fries are cooked in beef tallow and are awesome. It's definitely not the fastest burger in the city but worth the wait. Now if only I had a beer to go with my burger...
author: Heather S.

description: Best burger and shakes in town!  And they're super nice.  My new go-to burger spot.
author: Michelle D.

description: Amazing! Cheeseburger with fried egg and side of fries!! Friendly staff, perfect cooked juicy burger with house made ketchup and an oozing fried egg, all smashed between a toasted bun. I'll be back!
author: Elsa M.

description: Hella good ! And they actually cook their meat the way you want it. Rivals  super duper ! Wish they had a special sauce though
author: Mel F.

description: Solid burger choice in West Portal. Bf got the quarter pound beef burger. Tastes like real beef, not processed fast food "meat". I got the vegetarian burger. Flavorful house made patty. If you're looking for a hockey puck, buy a frozen Boca burger from Safeway. Vegan fries are good. The house made ketchup is not like the Heinz ketchup also offered, it tastes like crushed tomatoes. Prices are not cheap, $20 for 2 burgers and one order of fries; figure you gotta shell out for the organic stuff. 4 stars for the 2 owners who try really, really hard. They work their butts off to create quality meals for their customers. To us, they've succeeded because we've been twice and are regulars now.
author: Presto G.

description: My husband and kids are connoisseurs of good burgers and this one is at the top of the chart.  My family devoured their burgers and declared them better than Super Duper or any of the high-end burger joints we've had in SF.  The service was friendly, the fries delicious and the milkshakes were made from organic three twins ice cream.  The bonus was that we were able to watch the Warriors-Clippers game as we ate our food.  We will definitely be back!
author: Suzanne P.

description: Great tasty, fresh and flavorful burger! Yummy fries and amazing shake! Helpful, friendly and courteous employees. Perfect location and really nice addition to the neighborhood. Enjoy with family or friends or even take out.
author: T. M.

description: I love burgers and Calibur makes a great one! They have fresh organic ingredients and quality meat.  You can choose the size of your patty so you won't leave hungry. They make their own ketchup which adds to the distinct flavor of the burger. I also can't get enough of their delectable fries and shakes. I have make the trek to West Portal from the Marina but for this burger place it's well worth it!!
author: Jon M.

description: Love the burgers and shakes. The fries are consistently soggy. They need to produce crispy fries and they will be complete. I'm rooting for them to get the fries right.
author: David R.

description: This rating is based solely on their veggie burger, which was the best I've had in a long time.  Everyone's preferences are different, of course (I see one recent reviewer could have made a better one "in the comfort of her own home"), and one person's five star veggie burger isn't necessarily another's, so I'll try and articulate what I liked about it without making comparisons to veggie burgers around town that I _do not like_ at all.  First, the patty itself was flavorful and just spicy enough.  Some veggie burgers are bland, and others rely - IMHO - too heavily on beets, and thus become too sweet.  I liked the texture of the patty as well.  It was firm without being too hard, and the contents were course without being too chunky.  If I had eaten the patty by itself I would have enjoyed it.  I found the bun to be just right: fresh, soft, and flavorful.  The lettuce, tomatoes, onion, and pickles both looked and tasted fresh - and were present in just the right quantities (personally, I'm always a little perplexed and disappointed when I end up with _just one pickle_ on a burger).  I got Swiss cheese and avocado and although I'm sure the whole thing would have been pretty good without these additions, the melted cheese really tied the whole thing together.  To each their own, but for my taste, this veggie burger rocks.
author: Marie M.
